child_pages.title: Visa processing timesVisa processing times
child_pages.summary: This page provides median visa processing times for key Australian visa categories as of October 2025. It explains factors that cause variations in processing times and outlines how users can view detailed processing information for their specific visa applications.

structured_data.overview: The Department aims to improve visa processing times while maintaining program integrity. Processing times can vary significantly based on application completeness, external checks, program place availability, and other factors.
reasons_for_processing_time_variation: Whether applications include all necessary supporting documents
Whether applications are lodged online or on paper; online applications help streamline processing
How quickly applicants respond to requests for further information
Time required to obtain information from external agencies, particularly for health, character, and national security checks
For permanent visas, the number of places available in the migration program
Fluctuations in the number of visa applications
Deciding older applications increases processing times

skilled_permanent.comments: Focus on reducing processing times across all permanent visas. Processing both new and older applications may cause monthly fluctuations as the oldest cases are progressed.

partner_provisional_temporary.comments: Efforts are focused on reducing times for Partner visas, particularly older and complex cases. This will affect monthly processing statistics as the oldest applications are finalised.

skilled_temporary.comments: Processing time reductions are a priority. Incomplete applications requiring additional information cause delays. Simultaneous lodgement of nomination and visa applications is encouraged. Focus also includes older and complex applications, affecting monthly averages.

student.comments: Applications lodged outside Australia are processed according to Ministerial Directions. Lodged before 14 November 2025: Ministerial Direction 111. Lodged on or after 14 November 2025: Ministerial Direction 115. Applicants should lodge well ahead of course commencement with complete documentation.

visitor.comments: Includes subclasses 600, 601, and 651. For subclass-specific times, refer to the global processing times guide.

ministerial_directions_for_student_visas.notes: Student visa applications lodged outside Australia follow these directions.

how_to_view_processing_times.instructions: Applicants can view processing time information using the visa processing times guide.
how_to_view_processing_times.update_frequency: Processing times are updated regularly as new data becomes available.
exceptions: Visas that are closed to new applications
Family visas that are capped and queued
Visas with too few decisions in the month to provide reliable processing time indicators

recommendations_for_faster_processing: Submit all necessary supporting documents at the time of application
Where possible, lodge nomination and visa applications simultaneously (for relevant visa types)

child_pages.title: Changing visas
child_pages.summary: This page provides guidance for people in Australia who want to apply for a new visa, including the rules around visa conditions, bridging visas, Expressions of Interest, and work rights. It explains when bridging visas are granted, how to remain lawful, and when work permissions may or may not be available.

key_points: Apply for another visa before your current visa expires if you want to stay in Australia.
Information provided on staying lawful, visa conditions, bridging visas, Expressions of Interest, and work rights.

restrictions: You cannot apply for a new visa in Australia if your current visa includes a 'no further stay' condition.
visa_conditions.how_to_check_conditions: You can check your visa conditions in VEVO.
visa_conditions.waivers: In some situations, you can ask for the 'no further stay' condition to be waived.

when_granted: If you apply for a new visa before your current substantive visa expires.
bridging_visas.automatic_application: In most cases, the bridging visa application is automatically included when applying for a new visa.
purpose: Allows you to stay in Australia when your substantive visa expires and while a decision is pending on your new visa.
activation_conditions: The bridging visa comes into effect only once the current substantive visa expires.
compliance_requirements: You must comply with the conditions of your current substantive visa until the bridging visa comes into effect.
cancellation_consequences: Cancelling your current visa will not activate your bridging visa.
Cancelling your current visa will cancel your bridging visa.
You would become unlawful in Australia if the bridging visa is cancelled.

key_facts: An Expression of Interest (EOI) is not a visa application.
Submitting an EOI does not result in the grant of a bridging visa.
Eligibility for a bridging visa is assessed only after a valid visa application is lodged.
expiry_scenarios: If your current visa is about to expire before you are invited to apply for a skilled visa, you must apply for another visa to remain in Australia.
If you do not meet requirements for another visa, you must depart Australia before your visa expires.

work_rights: Work rights depend on conditions attached to the Bridging Visa A (BVA).
working_on_a_bridging_visa.how_to_check: Work conditions can be confirmed in VEVO.

changing_work_rights.possibility: You can apply for another BVA that allows work.
requirements: You usually must demonstrate financial hardship.
Circumstances will be assessed in relation to your claim for work rights.
outcomes: If you do not meet requirements for work rights but are still eligible for a BVA, a new BVA will be granted with the same work restrictions as your previous BVA.

cannot_be_granted_work_rights_if: Your current BVA prevents or restricts work AND your BVA was granted because you applied for judicial review of your substantive visa application decision.
You have applied for a protection visa and are seeking a bridging visa based on judicial review.
work_rights_exceptions.special_note: Protection visa applicants applying for a bridging visa on the basis of judicial review who currently hold condition 8101 cannot apply for work rights.

child_pages.title: Fees and charges for visasFees and charges for visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about visa fees and related charges for Australian visa applications. It explains how visa costs are determined, circumstances that may affect charges, surcharge information, and links to resources such as the Visa Pricing Estimator and the Current Visa Pricing Table.

overview.description: The cost of visas changes over time. The visa charge applied is based on the date the application is received. If pricing increases between lodging and receipt of the application, the new charge must be paid.
payment_requirements: Applicants must ensure their daily limit and available funds can cover applicable surcharges.
The visa application charge is the amount payable in AUD for a visa application.
In some cases, the visa application charge may be nil.

visa_pricing_estimator.description: A tool to estimate the cost of a visa.

surcharges.description: A surcharge may apply when paying visa application charges, sponsorship fees, or nomination fees using credit card or PayPal.

current_pricing_table.description: The Visa Pricing Table helps applicants determine visa cost. It is divided into categories based on the applicant's intended activity in Australia.

components_list: What happens if the correct amount has not been paid?

page_structure_labels_found: Fees and charges for other services

child_pages.title: ​​​Check twice, submit once​
child_pages.summary: This page provides guidance on how to submit a complete, 'decision ready' visa application to ensure faster processing. It outlines common requirements, document preparation tips, and steps for using ImmiAccount for online visa applications.

key_messages: Get your visa application right the first time for faster processing.
Ensure all required documents and correct information are included at the time of application.
Submit applications well ahead of travel plans.

visa_application_categories.message: Join your family sooner than expected.

document_requirements: Ensure all required documents and correct information are included when applying.
Translate all non-English documents into English.
If in Australia, include the translator's NAATI practitioner number.
If outside Australia, include the translator’s full name, address, phone number, and qualifications in the translated language.
Check that your name is spelled correctly and matches the passport used for the application.
Check for autocorrect issues and list all names you have previously been known by.
under_18_requirements: Submit a copy of your passport.
Submit copies of each parent’s passport.

police_certificates.validity: Certificates must have been issued within the 12 months before applying.

health_checks.requirement: Most visa applications require a health check.
health_checks.option: Applicants may be able to get their health check before applying using the My Health Declarations Service.
health_checks.access: Accessible through 'Check when to have health examinations'.

immiaccount_monitoring: Check your ImmiAccount inbox regularly for updates and requests.
Respond quickly to requests for information to avoid delays.
If you cannot provide requested information, notify the department and explain why.
decision_ready_application_tips.biometric_data: Get biometric data collected promptly once requested.
submission_timing: Submit applications well ahead of intended travel.
Book flights only after visa grant.

steps_to_find_visa_document_requirements: Visit Department of Home Affairs website.
Enter the visa subclass number into the search bar (e.g., Visitor subclass 600).
Select the webpage for the chosen visa subclass.
Navigate to 'gather your documents', click 'show steps', then click through the 'see how' options.

immiaccount_information.description: ImmiAccount is the required platform for applying for most Australian visas.
immiaccount_information.setup_tip: Choose to receive electronic communication when creating an account.
functions: Track the progress of an application.
related_links: Learn how to create an ImmiAccount or login.

child_pages.title: Electronic Travel Authority
child_pages.summary: This page provides official information about the Electronic Travel Authority (ETA), subclass 601, for short-term travel to Australia. It explains eligibility, conditions, costs, application methods, stay periods, obligations, and restrictions for ETA holders.

structured_data.description: Allows eligible passport holders to visit Australia multiple times within 12 months, staying up to 3 months each visit.
key_points: Must apply using the Australian ETA app unless ineligible to use it.
Valid for 12 months or until passport expiry, whichever is sooner.
Multiple entry visa with max 3-month stay per visit.

stay.visa_validity: 12 months or until passport expires, whichever is shorter
stay.round_trip_cruise_policy: Time on a round trip cruise counts as time in Australia and does not reset stay period.

processing_times.advice: Do not make travel arrangements until the ETA is granted.

eligibility.application_method: Must use the Australian ETA app
eligibility.european_passport_holders_note: May be eligible for an eVisitor (subclass 651)

business_visitor_activities_allowed: Make general business or employment inquiries
Investigate, negotiate, enter into, or review a business contract
Conduct activities as part of an official government visit
Take part in conferences, trade fairs, or seminars (no payment allowed)
with_this_visa_you_can.study: Study or train for up to 3 months total.

work_restrictions: Cannot work for an Australian employer
Cannot provide services to an Australian business or organization
Cannot sell goods or services directly to the public

must_apply_for_subclass_600_if: Studying to be a doctor, dentist, nurse, or paramedic
Entering health care or hospital environments

cruise_rules.round_trip_cruise_definition_note: Ask cruise operator or travel agent whether cruise is considered round trip.

stay_longer.unlawful_consequences: Becoming an unlawful non-citizen and possible removal from Australia

including_family.note: Each family member, including those listed on your passport, must submit a separate application.

health_insurance.recommendation: Strongly recommended to obtain health insurance
health_insurance.responsibility: Traveller is personally liable for all healthcare costs
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare_agreements: Some countries have agreements; see Services Australia

travel.multiple_travel: Allowed as many times as desired while visa is valid

visa_label.passport_change_effect: ETA ceases when passport expires or new passport issued; must apply for new ETA

child_pages.title: eVisitor
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the eVisitor visa (subclass 651), which allows eligible passport holders to visit Australia for tourism or business activities for up to 3 months per entry within a 12‑month validity period. It outlines visa conditions, eligibility requirements, obligations, processing times, costs, and what applicants can and cannot do with this visa.

structured_data.description: Visit Australia as often as you wish in a 12‑month period. Stay up to 3 months each time you enter Australia.

notes: Round trip cruise time counts as time in Australia and does not reset stay period
Frequent or long stays may trigger questioning of genuine visitor status

business_visitor_activities: Make general business or employment enquiries
Investigate, negotiate, enter into or review a business contract
Conduct activities as part of an official government visit
Take part in a conference, trade fair or seminar (without payment from organisers)
what_you_can_do.study: Study or train for up to 3 months in total
study_limitations: If main purpose is study, a student visa is more appropriate
Applicants training at childcare centres or entering health/hospital environments should apply for Visitor visa (subclass 600)

work_restrictions: Cannot work for or provide services to an Australian organisation
Cannot sell goods or services to the public
Cannot perform paid work for an Australian employer
warnings: Visa may be cancelled if applicant works or intends to work in Australia
May be refused entry if attempting to work

cruise_information.visa_requirement: You will need a visa if you enter Australia during a cruise.
round_trip_cruise_rules: Time spent on cruise counts as time in Australia
Round trip does not reset stay period

instructions: Must apply for another visa to stay longer
For further short stays or holidays, Visitor visa (subclass 600) Tourist stream may be suitable
Remaining in Australia after visa expiry results in unlawful non‑citizen status

notes: Each family member must submit a separate application

apply_from.travel_arrangements_warning: Do not arrange travel until written confirmation of visa grant is received.

processing_times.note: Processing times shown in the visa processing time guide tool are indicative only.

obligations: Must meet all visa conditions
Must obey Australian laws

health_insurance.recommendation: Take out health insurance for unexpected medical treatment
health_insurance.liability: Applicant is personally liable for all healthcare costs
additional_info: Australia has reciprocal healthcare agreements with some countries
More information is available from Services Australia

travel.multiple_travel: Can travel outside and re‑enter Australia as many times as desired while visa is valid

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label is issued.

must_hold_passport_from: Vatican City (passport must indicate nationality of the Vatican City)

health_requirement.note: Applicants who previously failed the health requirement should apply for Visitor visa (subclass 600)

character_requirement.instructions: Applicants with criminal convictions should apply for Visitor visa (subclass 600)
character_requirement.warning: Arriving on an eVisitor with a criminal conviction may result in refusal of entry

genuine_visitor_requirement: Must obey all visa conditions and stay periods

must_have_enough_money: To leave Australia at the end of your stay

eligibility.best_interests_of_child: Visa might not be granted if not in the best interests of an applicant under 18.

child_pages.title: Transit visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Australian Transit Visa (Subclass 771). It explains who needs the visa, eligibility criteria, conditions, costs, obligations, and requirements for both regular travelers and Maritime Crew Visa holders. It also outlines when travelers may not need a Transit visa and provides guidance on application steps and conditions after arrival.

structured_data.description: Allows up to 72 hours in Australia for travelers transiting to another country or for Maritime Crew Visa holders entering Australia to join an eligible ship.
notes: If granted a Transit visa, most other Australian visas held will cease.
Travelers staying in Australia for less than 8 hours and not leaving the airport may not require a visa.
Individuals should first check VEVO or ImmiAccount to confirm whether they need a Transit visa.

stay_conditions.maritime_crew_visa_holders: Must join the eligible ship within 5 days of arrival by air

processing_times.note: Processing times can be checked using the visa processing time guide tool. Times shown are indicative only.

what_you_can_do: Transit through Australia for no longer than 72 hours
Enter Australia by air before joining the crew of an eligible ship as a Maritime Crew visa (subclass 988) holder within 5 days of arrival

general_requirements: Must be outside Australia to apply
Must be transiting Australia
Must have a confirmed booking to travel to another country within 72 hours of arrival in Australia
Must hold correct documents to enter the next destination country
maritime_crew_requirements: Must hold a Maritime Crew visa (MCV)
Must sign onto the eligible ship within 5 days of arrival

health_insurance.requirement: May be required to have adequate health cover for the entire stay
notes: Applicant is liable for all healthcare costs while in Australia
Insurance should cover medically necessary treatment including transport

eligibility.reciprocal_healthcare: Some countries have agreements with Australia; see Services Australia for details
eligibility.debt_to_government: Any outstanding debts to the Australian Government must be paid or arrangements made for repayment
eligibility.australian_values_statement: Applicants aged 18 or older must acknowledge the Australian Values Statement
eligibility.best_interests_of_child: Visa might not be granted if not in the best interests of an applicant under 18

conditions: Travelers staying less than 8 hours and not leaving the airport
Those who already hold a valid Australian temporary or permanent visa that allows transit
visa_holders_who_may_not_need_transit_vi: NZ passport holders eligible for Special Category Visa (subclass 444)
notes: Applying for and being granted a Transit visa may end any existing Australian visa.
Some visas have limited validity periods starting after first arrival.
Some visas are single-entry only.

mcv_conditions: Have 5 days from arrival by air to sign onto an eligible ship
MCV ceases if not signed on within 5 days
Must apply for a new Transit visa each time entering Australia by air to join a ship

family.notes: Each person, including babies on a parent's passport, must apply separately

application_conditions.apply_from: Must be outside Australia when applying and when visa is decided

obligations: Must comply with visa conditions
Must obey Australian laws

step_by_step.step_1: Check if you need a Transit visa by reviewing eligibility, especially if transiting for less than 8 hours without leaving the airport

child_pages.title: Visitor visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Australian Visitor visa (subclass 600) and its various streams. It outlines eligibility, stay periods, costs, conditions, and application requirements for each visa stream. It also includes notes about processing times, location requirements, and special conditions for certain nationalities.

structured_data.general_description: For tourists, business visitors, or to visit family for 3, 6 or 12 months.
basic_eligibility: Have enough funds to support your stay and leave
general_notes: Australian citizens are ineligible to apply for an eVisitor visa.
Visitor visa holders need to be aware of new laws restricting visa hopping to the Student visa program.
Applicants can use the visa processing time guide tool for estimated processing times.

streams.description: Lets you visit Australia as a tourist, to go on a cruise or to visit family and friends.
streams.stay: Up to 12 months; may be granted 3, 6 or 12 months
streams.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool; times are indicative only.
conditions: Must be outside Australia when applying and when the visa is decided.
Visit friends and family, cruise or have a holiday.

streams.description: Lets you visit Australia as a tourist, to visit family and friends or for purposes other than business or medical treatment.
streams.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool; times are indicative only.
conditions: Must be in Australia when applying and when the visa is decided.
Visit friends and family, cruise or have a holiday.
Suitable for those holding another visa that is expiring and wanting to stay longer.

streams.description: Lets you visit Australia for business reasons.
streams.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool; times are indicative only.
conditions: Can make a short visit for business visitor reasons.
Cannot work or sell goods or services.
May allow single or multiple entries.
Must be outside Australia when applying and when the visa is decided.

streams.description: For citizens from certain areas of China visiting Australia on a tour organised by an approved travel agent.
streams.stay: For the period or until the date specified in the grant letter
streams.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool; processing times influenced by backlog from border closures.
conditions: For citizens of the People's Republic of China (excluding SARs).
Must visit Australia with an organised tour group.
Must remain with the organised tour group.

streams.description: For frequent travellers from eligible countries visiting Australia for tourism or business visitor activities.
streams.stay: Visa valid up to 10 years; stay up to 3 months per entry
conditions: Visit for tourism and/or business visitor activities.
Must be outside Australia when applying and when the visa is decided.

streams.description: For people who are sponsored, usually by a family member, to visit their family members in Australia.
streams.additional_cost_notes: Sponsor may be asked to pay a security bond.
streams.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool; times are indicative only.
conditions: Must be sponsored by an eligible family member who is an Australian citizen or permanent resident.
Sponsor may be required to pay a security bond.
Must be outside Australia when applying and when the visa is decided.

child_pages.title: Work and Holiday
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Australian Work and Holiday visa (subclass 462), including the first, second, and third visa options. It outlines eligibility requirements, work conditions, stay periods, costs, processing guidance, and important conditions that may affect applicants' visa status. The content is intended for young adults aged 18 to 30 from eligible countries seeking extended holidays in Australia while working to fund their stay.

visa_program.name: Work and Holiday Visa
general_eligibility: Must have a passport from an eligible country
Must not be accompanied by dependent children
Must declare current location correctly on visa application form
important_notices: If holding a Working Holiday Maker visa (subclass 417 or 462) and another visa is granted, the WHM visa will end.
Visas such as eVisitor (subclass 651) or Transit (subclass 771) will cause WHM visas to cease on the grant date.
Ending a WHM visa may stop applicants from working in Australia.
Incorrect location information may prevent visa approval.
Applicants should not arrange travel to Australia until receiving written visa grant confirmation.

ballot_requirement.description: Applicants must participate in a visa pre-application ballot and be randomly selected before applying for the first Work and Holiday visa.

visa_variants.description: Allows eligible individuals aged 18 to 30 to have an extended holiday in Australia and work to help fund their trip.
requirements: Must have a passport from an eligible country
permissions: Can work while in Australia
Can apply for a second Work and Holiday visa if eligibility criteria are met
visa_variants.processing_time_note: Processing times vary; use the visa processing time guide tool for recently decided applications. Times are indicative only and may be longer due to application volume.

visa_variants.description: Allows individuals who currently hold or have previously held a Work and Holiday visa to have a second working holiday in Australia.
requirements: Must have a passport from an eligible country
Must have completed 3 months of specified subclass 462 work
If in Australia, must hold a substantive visa or have had last substantive visa expire less than 28 days ago
permissions: Can do any kind of work while in Australia
Can apply for a third Work and Holiday visa if conditions are met
visa_variants.processing_time_note: Processing times vary; use the visa processing time guide tool for recently decided applications. Times are indicative only and may be longer due to application volume.

visa_variants.description: Allows individuals who currently hold or have held a second Work and Holiday (subclass 462) visa to have a third working holiday in Australia.
requirements: Must have a passport from an eligible country
Must have completed 6 months of specified subclass 462 work
If in Australia, must hold a substantive visa or have had last substantive visa expire less than 28 days ago
permissions: Can do any kind of work while in Australia
visa_variants.processing_time_note: Processing times vary; use the visa processing time guide tool for recently decided applications. Times are indicative only and may be longer due to application volume.

child_pages.title: Working Holiday visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Australian Working Holiday visa (subclass 417), including its first, second, and third visa options. It outlines eligibility criteria, work requirements, costs, and important conditions applicants must follow. The content also highlights requirements regarding applicant location, passport eligibility, and factors that may affect visa continuity.

visa_program.description: For young adults who want an extended holiday in Australia and work to fund their stay.

general_eligibility.age_requirement: 18 to 30 years old (or 35 years old for some countries)
general_eligibility.passport_requirement: Must have a passport from an eligible country or jurisdiction
general_eligibility.dependent_children: Must not be accompanied by dependent children
visa_continuity_warning: If you hold a Working Holiday Maker (WHM) visa (subclass 417 or 462) and another visa is granted, your WHM visa will end.
Visas such as eVisitor (subclass 651) or Transit (subclass 771) will cause the WHM visa to cease on the date the new visa is granted.
Losing WHM visa status may stop you from working in Australia and affect your ability to apply for another WHM visa.
general_eligibility.location_declaration: Applicants must correctly declare their current location on the visa application form; incorrect location may prevent visa grant.

visa_variants.description: Allows eligible young adults to have their first extended holiday in Australia and work to fund their stay.
eligibility: Must be 18 to 30 years old (or 35 years old for some countries)
Must have a passport from an eligible country or jurisdiction
rights_and_conditions: You can work while you are in Australia
You can apply for a second Working Holiday visa if eligibility criteria are met
visa_variants.processing_time_note: Processing times can be checked using the visa processing time guide tool. Times shown are indicative and may vary due to application volumes. Applicants should not arrange travel until visa grant is confirmed.

links.details: Details section referenced in the text (no URL provided)

visa_variants.description: Allows previous Working Holiday visa holders to have a second working holiday in Australia.
eligibility: Must be 18 to 30 years old (or 35 years old for some countries)
Must have a passport from an eligible country or jurisdiction
Must have completed 3 months of specified subclass 417 work
If applying in Australia, must hold a substantive visa OR last substantive visa must have expired less than 28 days ago
rights_and_conditions: You can do any kind of work while in Australia
You can apply for a third Working Holiday visa if eligibility criteria are met
visa_variants.processing_time_note: Processing times can be checked using the visa processing time guide tool. Times shown are indicative and may vary due to application volumes. Applicants should not arrange travel until visa grant is confirmed.

links.details: Details section referenced in the text (no URL provided)

eligibility: Must be 18 to 30 years old (or 35 years old for some countries)
Must have a passport from an eligible country or jurisdiction
Must have completed 6 months of specified subclass 417 work
If applying in Australia, must hold a substantive visa OR last substantive visa must have expired less than 28 days ago
rights_and_conditions: You can do any kind of work while in Australia
visa_variants.processing_time_note: Processing times can be checked using the visa processing time guide tool. Times shown are indicative and may vary due to application volumes. Applicants should not arrange travel until visa grant is confirmed.

child_pages.title: Student visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Australian Student Visa (Subclass 500). It outlines eligibility, costs, processing rules, what the visa allows, and special conditions such as COVID‑19 fee waivers and reduced costs for eligible Pacific Island and Timor-Leste citizens.

structured_data.description: Visit Australia to participate in an eligible course of study.

stay_duration.general: Up to 6 years, in line with enrolment.
stay_duration.type_notes: Length determined by type and length of course.

processing_times.notes: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times. Times vary and are not specific to individual applications.
processing_times.additional_info: Processing priorities differ for applications lodged outside Australia under Ministerial Directions 111 or 115.

what_you_can_do_with_this_visa: Participate in an eligible course of study in Australia
Travel in and out of Australia
Work up to 48 hours per fortnight when course is in session
Unlimited work hours for masters by research or doctoral degree students and their families

general_requirements: Apply online in or outside Australia
Be enrolled in a course of study and hold a valid Confirmation of Enrolment (CoE) at time of decision
Hold Overseas Student Health Cover (OSHC) or be exempt
Be at least 6 years old
Provide welfare arrangements if under 18
If applying in Australia, hold an eligible substantive visa
important_notes: A CoE is invalid if cancelled or if the course is completed.
A substantive visa ceases once another substantive visa is granted.
Applications are received in AEST or AEDST depending on time of year.

cost.base_cost: From AUD2,000.00 for the main applicant (unless exempt)
cost.pricing_estimator_note: Visa Pricing Estimator does not include additional costs.

cost_exemption_pacific_and_timor_leste.description: Lower visa cost applies to eligible Pacific Island and Timor-Leste citizens for Student and Student Guardian visa applications.
cost_exemption_pacific_and_timor_leste.eligibility_basis: Recognised via valid passport from eligible countries at time of application.
cost_exemption_pacific_and_timor_leste.family_members_eligibility: Family members also eligible; assessment based on primary applicant’s passport.

eligibility_conditions: Held a Student visa on or after 1 February 2020
Deferred study due to travel restrictions
Forced to reduce to part‑time study
Unable to complete work-based training or placements
requirements: Must apply for a new Student visa for fee waiver consideration
Must attach Form 1545 COVID-19 Impacted Student completed by education provider
covid_19_impacted_students_fee_waiver.bridging_visa_note: If applying in Australia, a Bridging visa will not be issued automatically until fee exemption is checked.
covid_19_impacted_students_fee_waiver.waiver_scope: Applies only to the visa application charge.

family_definitions: Dependent child of applicant or partner who is unmarried and under 18
important_notes: A child who is 18 or older when the visa is finalised cannot be granted this visa.
All family members must be declared in the application even if not travelling.

options: Apply for a new Student visa to continue studying
If visa expires before graduation, may apply for Visitor visa (subclass 600) with graduation date letter
If eligible after completing specific qualifications, apply for Temporary Graduate visa (subclass 485)
Apply for a different visa suited to circumstances if remaining in Australia for other reasons

help_with_your_visa.advice: Read information on who can help before paying someone to assist with the application.

child_pages.title: Student Guardian visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 590 Student Guardian visa, which allows eligible relatives to travel to Australia to provide care and support for a student visa holder. It outlines eligibility criteria, costs, stay conditions, obligations, processing times, and application requirements.

structured_data.description: Temporary visa allowing a parent, custodian, or eligible relative to come to Australia to provide care and support for a student visa holder.
structured_data.purpose: Provide care and support for a student visa holder who is under 18 years old, or older in exceptional circumstances.

stay.details: You can stay in Australia until the date specified on your visa grant letter, usually aligned with the student visa holder’s stay or when the student turns 18.
stay.extend_stay: You can apply for a further Student Guardian visa to stay longer.

work_rights.notes: Work is not permitted on this visa.

allowed_study: ELICOS for less than 20 hours per week
Other study or training for up to 3 months

include_family_rules.general_rule: You cannot include children under 6 years old unless exceptions apply.
exceptions: Granting the visa would significantly benefit the relationship between the Australian Government and the government of another country
additional_conditions: This applies even if the children under 6 years old are not travelling.
If granted, the visa is only valid until the child’s 6th birthday.
Children 6 and older must apply for their own Student visa.
You cannot add children under 6 after submitting your application.

costs.estimator_note: Visa Pricing Estimator does not include additional costs.

pacific_exemption.description: Lower visa cost for eligible Pacific Island and Timor-Leste citizens applying for Student or Student Guardian visas.
pacific_exemption.eligibility_basis: Primary applicant’s valid passport from specified countries
pacific_exemption.family_eligibility: Family members are eligible based on the primary applicant's passport.

apply_from.conditions_if_inside_australia: Must hold an eligible substantive visa.
apply_from.reference: See 'Have this visa if applying while in Australia' under Eligibility section.

notes: Times are based on recently decided applications and not specific to individual cases.
Applications may take longer if incomplete, incorrect, missing documents, or require verification.
Application cannot be processed without correct visa application charge.

travel.rights: Unlimited travel in and out of Australia while visa is valid.
conditions: You cannot leave Australia without the student unless alternative welfare arrangements are made.
Time spent outside Australia does not extend the visa.

requirements: Must financially support yourself while in Australia.
Must financially support any accompanying family members.

visa_label.note: No physical visa label; visa is digitally linked to passport.

eligibility.eligibility_overview: Must meet all criteria, provide support to the student, and satisfy visa conditions.

must_hold_substantive_visa_except: Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) – Domestic Worker stream
Domestic Worker (Temporary) Diplomatic and Consular visa (subclass 426)
Diplomatic (Temporary) visa (subclass 995) – primary visa holder only
additional_rules: Family members of subclass 995 can apply for a Student visa in Australia.

If you do not hold an eligible substantive visa, you can apply within 28 days of either holding a student/special purpose/dependent diplomatic visa or being notified that your visa cancellation has been set aside.

must_be: parent of the student visa holder
person with custody of the student
a relative aged 21 or older nominated in writing by a parent or custodian
care_requirements: student visa holder 18 or older who requires support due to exceptional circumstances

other_requirements: Must have sufficient funds for self and student.
Must provide accommodation, welfare, and support.
Must hold an eligible substantive visa if applying in Australia.

allowed: provide care and support for the student
care for more than one student
restrictions: cannot work

key_points: Must support a student visa holder who is under 18 or older in exceptional circumstances.
Financial, accommodation, and welfare responsibilities apply.
Children under 6 almost always cannot be included.

child_pages.title: Training visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Australian Training Visa (Subclass 407), a temporary visa that allows individuals to undertake workplace-based occupational training or professional development in Australia. It outlines visa features, eligibility criteria, costs, conditions, obligations, nomination types, family inclusion rules, and application procedures.

visa_details.description: This visa allows you to take part in workplace-based occupational training activities to improve your skills for your job, area of tertiary study, field of expertise, or in a professional development training program in Australia.
visa_details.travel_rights: Multiple entries allowed while visa is valid

costs.additional_applicant_costs: Additional charge applies for each family member
costs.pricing_estimator_note: Visa Pricing Estimator does not include additional costs

notes: Processing times shown are for recently decided applications
Times are indicative only
Applications may take longer if not completed correctly, documents are missing, more information is required, or verification is needed
processing_times.payment_requirement: Application cannot be processed unless the correct visa application charge is paid

sponsor_requirements: Sponsor must be an approved temporary activities sponsor
nomination_requirements: You must be nominated unless your sponsor is a Commonwealth Government agency
eligibility.invitation_requirement: If your sponsor is a Commonwealth Government agency, you must be invited
eligibility.age_requirement: Generally must be 18 years or older at time of decision

excluded_visas: Subclass 403 (Temporary Work International Relations – Domestic Worker stream)
if_applying_in_australia.if_no_substantive_visa: Last substantive visa must not have been one of the excluded visas and application must be lodged within 28 days of last substantive visa expiry or AAT notification

nomination_types.description: Nomination is the stage where the sponsor provides details about the nominee, the purpose or type of training, and how and where the training will be provided.
types: Occupational training to improve skills in an eligible occupation
Occupational training for capacity building overseas (including overseas qualification, government support, or professional training)

with_this_visa_you_can: Visit Australia to complete workplace-based training to improve skills for your occupation, tertiary study area, or field of expertise
Participate in a professional development training program

stay_information.stay_longer: You cannot extend this visa; you can apply for another visa
stay_information.re_entry: You can leave and re-enter Australia while the visa is valid

requirements: Family members must meet health and character requirements
If applying from outside Australia, non-travelling family members may also need to meet health requirements
family_members.newborn_children: Information available on what to do if a child is born after application or during visa validity

subsequent_entrants.application_method: Temporary Work and Activity Visa (Subsequent Entrant) (403, 407, 408) form in ImmiAccount
requirements: Must be listed on the nomination form if the sponsor is not a Commonwealth Government agency
Must provide a letter from the primary applicant's sponsor confirming willingness to sponsor them

application_information.apply_from: You can be in or outside Australia when you apply and when the application is decided
application_information.help_with_visa: Applicants should check who is legally allowed to assist with their visa application before paying anyone

general_obligations: You and your family must obey all Australian laws
financial_support: You must be able to financially support yourself in Australia
You must be able to financially support any accompanying family members

requirements: If you decide to train with another organisation, they must sponsor you
The new organisation must submit a new nomination
Once the nomination is approved, you may train with the new organisation for the remaining visa period
changing_sponsors.need_new_visa: You do not need a new visa unless the occupational training program itself changes
changing_sponsors.sponsor_ends_training: You must notify the government and may attempt to find another sponsor

requirements: You will need continuing sponsorship to apply for another Training visa (subclass 407)
You may need to explain why you were unable to complete the initial training

child_pages.title: Adoption visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Adoption visa (subclass 102), a permanent visa allowing a child adopted outside Australia to live in Australia with their adoptive parent. It outlines eligibility criteria, costs, processing times, obligations, and key rules for travel, application, and intercountry adoption.

structured_data.description: This visa lets children adopted outside Australia live in Australia with their adoptive parent.

key_updates.details: Applicants for Child visa subclasses 101, 102, 802, 445, 117 and 837 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount.

key_updates.note: Some applications lodged outside Australia before 1 April 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.

stay_and_travel_rights.stay: Indefinitely in Australia as a permanent resident
stay_and_travel_rights.travel_facility: 5 years from date of visa grant
after_travel_facility_expires: Apply for a Resident Return Visa (RRV) to re-enter Australia
Consider Australian citizenship; Australian citizens do not require a visa to enter and must use an Australian passport

benefits: Live in Australia indefinitely
Work and study in Australia
Enrol in Medicare
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Attend free English classes through the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)
Apply for Australian citizenship (if eligible)

eligibility.age_requirements: Child must be under 18 at adoption, when applying, and when decision is made
eligibility.location_requirements: Child must be outside Australia when applying and when decision is made
adoption_requirements: Child must have been adopted or be in the process of being adopted by their sponsor parent
eligibility.covid_concessions: Child may be eligible for COVID-19 visa concessions

accepted_adoption_types: Intercountry adoption involving an Australian state or territory central authority
Intercountry adoption between two Hague Convention countries
Expatriate adoption with no involvement of Australian state or territory central authority
sponsor_requirements: Sponsor must be an Australian citizen, eligible New Zealand citizen, or Australian permanent visa holder
Sponsor must have resided outside Australia for more than 12 months before lodging the application

government_role: Australian government does not issue letters of no objection
Their role is to assess and decide visa applications
country_restrictions: Adoption visa applications cannot be accepted for children adopted in Pakistan

including_other_children.siblings: Separate applications must be lodged for each sibling
dependent_children: Child’s dependent children may be included when applying or added before a decision
Dependent children must meet health requirements
Non-migrating family members may also need to meet health requirements

tools: Visa Pricing Estimator (does not include additional costs)

application_rules.apply_from: Child must be outside Australia at time of application

processing_times.note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent processing times
factors_that_delay_processing: Incomplete payment or payment of incorrect visa charge

obligations.first_entry_requirement: Child must enter Australia before the date specified in the grant letter (generally within 12 months of visa grant)
legal_requirements: Must comply with all visa conditions

visa_label.linking_method: Visa is digitally linked to child’s passport

other_information.help_with_visa: Applicants should read information about who can assist with visa applications before paying anyone

child_pages.title: Aged Dependent Relative visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 114 Aged Dependent Relative visa, a permanent visa for older, single individuals who rely financially on a relative in Australia. It outlines the visa's benefits, eligibility requirements, costs, processing conditions, and obligations for applicants and sponsors.

visa_details.description: This permanent visa lets a single older person, who relies on a relative living in Australia for financial support, move to Australia permanently.

notes: Unlimited travel to and from Australia within first 5 years
After 5 years, must apply for a Resident Return Visa (RRV) to re-enter as a permanent resident
Australian citizenship removes need for a visa; an Australian passport is required for travel

benefits: Stay in Australia indefinitely
Work and study in Australia
Enrol in Medicare (Australia's public healthcare scheme)
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Attend free English language classes through the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)
Apply for Australian citizenship (if eligible)

location_requirements: Applicant must be outside Australia when applying
Applicant must be outside Australia when the application is decided
sponsor_requirements: Must be sponsored by an eligible relative or the relative's partner
eligibility.age_requirement: Must be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia
dependence_requirement: Must have been financially dependent on an Australian relative for basic needs (food, shelter, clothing) for at least 3 years before applying
Dependency may be due to disability preventing work

assurance_of_support.description: Assures the government the applicant will not rely on government assistance
assurance_of_support.applies_to: Applicant and any accompanying family members

applies_to: Possibly non-migrating family members if requested
Possibly non-migrating family members if requested

eligibility.debt_requirement: All debts to the Australian Government must be repaid or have an approved repayment plan
eligibility.visa_history: Applications may be refused if the applicant has had prior visas cancelled or refused; some exceptions apply for offshore applicants
eligibility.best_interests_of_child: The visa will not be granted if it is not in the best interests of an applicant under 18

when_to_include: Any time before a decision is made
family_inclusion.required_information: Must provide details of all family members, whether migrating or not
requirements_for_family_members: May need to meet character requirements

payment_structure: First instalment payable at time of application
tools: Visa Pricing Estimator (does not include second instalment or additional costs)

application_process.apply_from: All applicants must be outside Australia when applying and when the decision is made

notes: Demand for Other Family visas is high and places are limited
Processing times can be lengthy
Visa processing time guide tool gives estimates based on recent applications
processing_times.payment_requirement: Application cannot be processed if the correct visa application charge is not paid
processing_times.queueing: Applications are subject to capping and queueing

related_reports: Reports on Migration Programs (outcomes for each migration year)

obligations.entry_requirement: Must enter Australia before the date specified in the grant letter (usually 12 months from grant)

visa_label.notes: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided

help_and_support.visa_assistance: Applicants should review information on who can legally assist with visa applications before paying anyone

child_pages.title: Aged Dependent Relative visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 838 Aged Dependent Relative visa. It explains eligibility requirements, costs, processing times, application conditions, and what applicants can do once they hold this permanent visa. It also includes rules about travel validity, sponsorship, family inclusion, and application processing changes starting 23 July 2025.

structured_data.description: This visa lets a single older person stay in Australia permanently if they rely on a relative living in Australia for financial support.

key_updates.import_limitations: Some existing applications made outside Australia before 25 June 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.

what_you_can_do_with_this_visa: Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Attend free English language classes under the Adult Migrant English Program, if eligible
Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible

travel_rules: Unlimited travel in and out of Australia during validity
After 5 years, must obtain a Resident Return Visa (RRV) to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Australian citizenship removes the need for a visa to re-enter Australia

application_conditions.apply_from: Applicant must be in Australia but not in immigration clearance both at application and decision time
application_conditions.family_members_apply_from: Family members applying with the applicant must also be in Australia and not in immigration clearance

include_family.when: Anytime before a decision is made
requirements: Must provide details of all family members, whether migrating or not
Family members must meet health and character requirements

additional_costs: Extra charge for each family member applying
tools: Visa Pricing Estimator (does not include second instalment or other costs)

notes: Demand exceeds yearly available places
Processing can be lengthy
Times shown are for recently decided applications and are not specific to individual applications
processing_times.queue_information: Applications are subject to capping and queueing

visa_label.linking_method: Visa is digitally linked to passport

sponsor_requirement.details: Must be sponsored by an eligible relative or the relative's partner; sponsorship must be approved

eligibility.age_requirement: Must be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia

dependency_requirement.description: Must have been dependent on the relative in Australia for basic needs such as food, shelter, and clothing for at least the last 3 years
dependency_requirement.alternative: Dependency may be due to disability preventing work

assurance_of_support.details: Assures the government the applicant will not rely on public assistance; applies to the applicant and any migrating family members
assurance_of_support.notification: The department will inform the applicant when to obtain the assurance

eligibility.health_requirement: Applicant and any applying family members must meet the health requirement

help_with_visa.advice: Read information on who can help with your visa application before paying someone

additional_notes.reports_reference: Reports on Migration Programs provide details on outcomes against planning levels
additional_notes.related_updates_link: Update to ImmiAccount – new online services for paper-based Child, Other Family, Former Residents, and New Zealand Citizen Family Relationship visa applications

child_pages.title: Aged Parent visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Aged Parent visa (subclass 804), a permanent visa for aged parents of settled Australian citizens, permanent residents, or eligible New Zealand citizens. It outlines eligibility requirements, costs, processing times, conditions, travel rights, and application procedures.

structured_data.description: This visa allows an aged parent of a settled Australian citizen, Australian permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen to live in Australia permanently.
key_features: Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Attend free English language classes if eligible
Apply for Australian citizenship if eligible

stay_conditions.citizenship_note: Permanent residence for citizenship purposes starts on the date the visa is granted

travel_facility.travel_period: 5 years from the date of grant
conditions: Unlimited travel as long as the travel facility is valid
After 5 years, a Resident Return Visa (RRV) is required for re-entry
Australian citizenship removes the need for a visa to re-enter Australia
travel_facility.check_travel_facility: Use VEVO to check travel facility expiry

eligibility.must_have_an_eligible_child: Child must be a settled Australian citizen, permanent resident, or eligible New Zealand citizen
eligibility.age_requirement: Must be old enough to receive the age pension in Australia
eligibility.not_have_this_visa: Must not have already applied for or hold a Sponsored Parent (Temporary) visa (subclass 870)

sponsor_requirement.sponsor_must_be: Eligible sponsor, usually an eligible child
sponsor_requirement.if_child_under_18: Sponsor can be an eligible relative or community organisation

assurance_of_support.requirement: Applicant must obtain an assurance of support
assurance_of_support.purpose: Ensures the applicant will not rely on government assistance during the assurance period
assurance_of_support.covers: Applicant and any accompanying family members

costs.base_cost: AUD 7,345.00 for a single applicant, paid in two instalments
additional_costs: Additional charges for each accompanying family member
references: Fees and charges for other services

processing_times.note: Processing times are lengthy due to high demand and limited places
processing_times.queueing: Applications are subject to capping and queueing and processed in date order
two_stage_assessment: Initial assessment to check eligibility and place in queue or refuse
Final assessment when a place becomes available
processing_times.payment_note: Application won’t be processed if the correct visa fee is not paid

application_requirements.apply_from: Must be in Australia, but not in immigration clearance, at time of application
application_requirements.family_members: Family members included in the application must also be in Australia and not in immigration clearance
obligations: Meet all visa conditions
Obey Australian laws

family_inclusion.can_include: Members of the family unit at the time of application
family_inclusion.must_list_all_family_members: Must list all family members, whether migrating or not
family_inclusion.health_and_character_requirements: All included and some non-migrating family members may be required to meet health and character requirements
family_inclusion.newborn_child_note: Applicants must follow procedures if a child is born after application

visa_label.label_status: No physical visa label will be placed in the passport

related_visas.name: Contributory Aged Parent visa
related_visas.notes: Permanent visa; faster processing but higher cost than subclass 804

related_visas.name: Contributory Aged Parent (Temporary) visa
related_visas.notes: Temporary visa leading to subclass 864; faster but more expensive overall, cost spread over two visas

related_visas.name: Sponsored Parent (Temporary) visa
related_visas.notes: Temporary visa allowing parents to stay for up to 3 or 5 years at a time, max cumulative 10 years

important_warnings: Do not make permanent stay arrangements until visa approval is confirmed
Application may be returned if incorrect fees are paid

help_information.help_with_application: Applicants should verify who is legally allowed to provide immigration assistance before paying for help

child_pages.title: Carer visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 836 Carer visa, a permanent visa for individuals in Australia who need to care for an Australian relative with a long-term medical condition and no reasonable access to care. It outlines eligibility criteria, costs, how to apply, processing times, conditions, obligations, and travel rights.

structured_data.description: This visa lets you stay in Australia to provide care to someone with a long-term medical condition who does not have reasonable access to care options in Australia.

key_updates.details: Applicants for Other Family subclasses 114, 115, 116, 835, 836 and 838 can import their paper application into ImmiAccount.
key_updates.exceptions: Some existing applications made outside of Australia before 25 June 2020 cannot be imported into ImmiAccount.

benefits: Stay in Australia indefinitely
Work and study in Australia
Enrol in Medicare
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Attend free English classes (if eligible)
Apply for Australian citizenship (if eligible)

travel_facility.validity: 5 years from date of visa grant
notes: Unlimited travel while the travel facility is valid
After 5 years, applicants must apply for a Resident Return Visa (RRV) to re‑enter Australia as a permanent resident
Australian citizenship removes the need for a visa for re-entry

location_requirements: Must be in Australia when applying
Must be in Australia when the decision is made
carer_requirements: Must be willing and able to provide ongoing substantial care and support
Must understand the medical condition and care needs of the person requiring care
The person being cared for must be an Australian relative or their family member living with them
sponsor_requirements: Must be sponsored by an eligible sponsor
visa_status_requirements: Must hold any substantive visa except Transit visa (subclass 771)
Or have held any substantive visa except subclass 771 and made a valid Subclass 836 application within a required timeframe
eligibility.health_requirement: Applicant and included family members must meet the health requirement
eligibility.character_requirement: Applicant and included family members must meet the character requirement

requirements: Family members included must meet health and character requirements

payment_structure: First instalment paid at time of application

second_instalment_reduction.conditions: May be reduced to nil if paying the instalment would cause severe financial hardship to the applicant or the person needing care
second_instalment_reduction.exclusions: Second instalment cannot be reduced for accompanying family members

cost.cost_estimator: Visa Pricing Estimator does not include second instalment or additional costs

application_process.decision_location: Must be in Australia when decision is made

notes: Demand for Other Family visas exceeds available places each year
Applications may be subject to long processing times
Subject to capping and queueing
processing_times.processing_time_guidance: Visa processing time guide tool provides recent decision timeframes
delays_caused_by: Missing documents or need for further information
