key_points: From 1 May 2025, the Pacific Engagement visa (subclass 192) consists of two streams: the Pacific Engagement stream and the Treaty stream.
Ballots for the 2025–26 period are specific to each visa stream.
important_dates: 1 May 2025 – Introduction of two separate visa streams
25 August 2025 – Pacific Engagement stream ballot closed

child_pages.title: Regional Sponsored Migration Scheme visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the Regional Sponsored Migration Scheme visa (subclass 187), including its streams, eligibility requirements, costs and processing guidance. The Direct Entry stream is closed to new applications, while the Temporary Residence Transition stream remains available for eligible transitional workers.

structured_data.description: This visa allows skilled workers who are nominated by their employer in regional Australia to live and work in Australia permanently.
general_eligibility: Be nominated by an approved Australian employer for a job in regional Australia
Meet the skills, qualifications and English language requirements
structured_data.income_threshold_note: Skilled visa income thresholds are increasing in line with changes to annual Average Weekly Ordinary Time Earnings.
structured_data.income_threshold_reference: Annual indexation of skilled visa income thresholds from 1 July 2025

streams.processing_time_note: For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the visa processing time guide tool. This will show processing times for recently decided applications and is a guide only, not specific to an individual application.

streams.description: This visa allows skilled workers, who are nominated by their employer in regional Australia, to live and work in Australia permanently.
eligibility: Must be a transitional subclass 457 or subclass 482 worker
Usually must have worked for the employer full-time for at least 2 years
Must be nominated by the employer
streams.processing_time_note: For an indication of processing times for this visa, use the visa processing time guide tool. This will show processing times for recently decided applications and is a guide only, not specific to an individual application.

child_pages.title: Skilled Employer Sponsored Regional (Provisional) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Skilled Employer Sponsored Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 494). It covers eligibility requirements, streams under the visa, costs, stay periods, and key conditions for skilled workers and their families. The visa supports regional employers by allowing them to sponsor skilled workers where suitable Australian workers cannot be sourced.

structured_data.description: This visa enables regional employers to address identified labour shortages within their region by sponsoring skilled workers where employers cannot source an appropriately skilled Australian worker.

requirements: Be nominated by an approved work sponsor
Have an occupation on a relevant skilled occupation list
Have a suitable skills assessment for the occupation
Be under 45 years of age
Meet minimum standards of English language proficiency
basic_eligibility.additional_information: Skilled visa income thresholds are increasing in line with changes to annual Average Weekly Ordinary Time Earnings.

streams.description: For skilled workers sponsored by regional employers to address labour shortages where suitably skilled Australian workers are not available.
conditions: You can live, work and study only in designated regional areas of Australia
You can apply for permanent residence after 3 years from the time your visa is granted
streams.processing_time_information: For an indication of processing times, use the visa processing time guide tool. This provides processing times for recently decided applications and is not specific to individual applications.

streams.description: For skilled workers nominated by employers who have a labour agreement with the Australian Government.
conditions: Employer must have a labour agreement with the Australian Government in effect
streams.processing_time_information: For an indication of processing times, use the visa processing time guide tool. This provides processing times for recently decided applications and is not specific to individual applications.

streams.description: For members of the family unit of a Skilled Employer Sponsored Regional (SESR) (Provisional) visa holder applying separately to join the primary holder in Australia.
conditions: Applicant must be a member of the family unit of an SESR visa holder
streams.processing_time_information: For an indication of processing times, use the visa processing time guide tool. This provides processing times for recently decided applications and is not specific to individual applications.

related_information.income_threshold_update_reference: Annual indexation of skilled visa income thresholds from 1 July 2025

child_pages.title: Skilled independent visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides a brief overview of the Subclass 189 Skilled Independent visa. It states who the visa is intended for and notes that applicants must meet basic eligibility requirements. The page also directs users to see the relevant stream for more details.

structured_data.description: A permanent visa for invited workers, eligible New Zealand citizens, and eligible Hong Kong or British National (Overseas) passport holders with skills needed in Australia to live and work permanently anywhere in the country.

child_pages.title: Skilled Nominated visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides official information about the Skilled Nominated Visa (Subclass 190), a permanent residency visa for skilled workers nominated by an Australian state or territory. It outlines visa benefits, eligibility criteria, costs, application requirements, and conditions after grant.

visa_details.description: This visa lets nominated skilled workers live and work in Australia as permanent residents.
visa_details.travel_validity: 5 years from the date of visa grant

permanent_residency_effective_date.if_outside_australia: Date of first entry into Australia with this visa

what_you_can_do: Live and stay in Australia permanently
Work and study anywhere in Australia
Attend free English language classes through the Adult Migrant English Program (if eligible)
Enrol in Medicare
Sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residency
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Become an Australian citizen if eligible

conditions_and_limitations.waiting_period_for_benefits: Newly arrived residents may need to wait before accessing certain Australian Government payments and benefits.

eligibility.occupation_requirement: Must have an occupation on the relevant skilled list

skills_assessment.requirement: Must have a suitable skills assessment for the nominated occupation
skills_assessment.validity_note: Skills assessment obtained within the 60‑day invitation period is accepted (Thapa decision)
medical_and_legal_exemptions: Full, unconditional, or general medical registration with AHPRA
Conditional specialist registration with AHPRA (must allow practice without supervision)
Admission to practice law in the relevant state or territory

nomination.requirement: Must be nominated by an Australian state or territory government agency
nomination.process: Submit an Expression of Interest (EOI) through SkillSelect
nomination.note_on_withdrawn_nomination: If the nominating state or territory withdraws your nomination after application, your application becomes invalid.

special_conditions_for_previous_visas.requirement: Must have held that visa for at least 3 years at the time of application

when_to_include: After lodging the application but before a decision is made

requirements.health_requirements: All family members applying must meet health requirements; non-accompanying family may also need to meet them
requirements.character_requirements: All family members applying must meet character requirements

including_family.note: If partner or dependent children are not included, you must provide a reason.

second_instalment_charge.applies_to: Applicants aged 18 or over with less than functional English
second_instalment_charge.when_paid: Only when requested and only if the visa is going to be granted

tools.visa_pricing_estimator_note: Does not include second instalment or other additional costs

apply_from.location: You can be inside or outside Australia when applying and when the visa is decided
apply_from.additional_requirements_if_in_australia: Must hold a substantive visa or eligible Bridging visa (A, B, or C)

processing_times.disclaimer: Processing times are indicative only and not specific to individual applications
case_by_case_factors: Completeness of the application and documentation
How quickly additional information is provided
Time to receive information from external agencies (health, character, national security)
Number of places available in the migration program

travel.travel_rights: Unlimited travel in and out of Australia for 5 years from visa grant
travel.after_5_years: Need Resident Return Visa (subclass 155 or 157) to re-enter as a permanent resident

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided

support.getting_help_with_visa: Read the information on who can help with your visa application before you pay someone.

child_pages.title: Skilled Regional (Provisional) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the Skilled Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489) and its three pathways: Invited, Extended Stay, and Subsequent Entry. It outlines who each pathway is for, the costs, stay periods, and basic requirements. The visa is closed to new applications for the Invited pathway.

structured_data.general_description: A temporary visa for skilled workers who want to live and work in regional Australia. Holders may be able to apply for the Skilled Regional (Permanent) visa (subclass 887).

invited_pathway.description: Temporary visa for skilled workers who want to live and work in regional Australia.
invited_pathway.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times. It is a guide only and not specific to individual applications.

extended_stay_pathway.description: Temporary visa for skilled workers who want to live and work in regional Australia.

requirements.regional_requirement: Must live, work and study in specified regional areas of Australia.
requirements.visa_requirement: Must hold a subclass 475, 487, 495 or 496 visa.

extended_stay_pathway.stay_period: 4 years from the date the current skilled visa was granted
extended_stay_pathway.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times. It is a guide only and not specific to individual applications.

subsequent_entry_pathway.description: For members of the family unit of someone who holds a Skilled Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 489) or a subclass 475, 487, 495 or 496 visa.

requirements.regional_requirement: Must live, work and study in specified regional areas of Australia.
requirements.family_requirement: Must be a member of the family unit of a holder of a subclass 475, 487, 489, 495 or 496 visa.

subsequent_entry_pathway.stay_period: Until the visa that the family member holds ends
subsequent_entry_pathway.processing_time_info: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times. It is a guide only and not specific to individual applications.

child_pages.title: Skilled Regional visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 887 Skilled Regional visa, a permanent visa for individuals who have lived and worked in regional Australia on an eligible provisional visa. It covers eligibility requirements, costs, application rules, COVID-19 concessions, family inclusion, travel rights, and obligations.

visa_details.description: This visa is for people who have lived and worked in specified areas of regional Australia on a previous, eligible visa.
visa_details.travel_component: 5 years from date of visa grant

citizenship_residence_start.outside_australia: Day the visa holder enters Australia on this visa

benefits: Work and study anywhere in Australia
Sponsor eligible relatives for permanent residence
Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible
Attend free English classes through the Adult Migrant English Program, if eligible
Enrol in Medicare
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years

general_requirements: Hold an eligible visa or have held an eligible visa that expired outside Australia during the concession period
Have lived for at least 2 years in a specified regional area unless COVID-19 concessions apply
Have worked full time for at least 1 year in a specified regional area unless COVID-19 concessions apply
Have complied with the conditions of the eligible visa held or previously held

benefits: Shorter employment requirement
Shorter residence requirement

required_evidence.full_time_work: At least 9 months in a specified regional area (or Minister-specified shorter period)
required_evidence.residence: At least 18 months in a specified regional area (or Minister-specified shorter period)

applicants_inside_australia.shorter_employment_requirement: At least 9 months full‑time work in a specified regional area
applicants_inside_australia.residence_requirement: 2 years of residence in a specified regional area

eligible_visas: Bridging Visa A or B after a valid application for subclass 489, 495, or 487
Expired eligible visas during concession period (offshore applicants)

application.apply_from: All applicants must be in Australia and hold an eligible visa at time of application unless COVID-19 concessions apply.
requirements: Submit complete application with supporting documents
Meet health and character requirements
Respond promptly to requests for information

inclusion_rules: Family members must currently hold an eligible visa
All eligible members must be included at time of application
Family cannot be added after application is submitted
Family who no longer meet standard definition (e.g., child over 23) can be included if holding an eligible visa granted based on previous family unit status
requirements: All included family must meet health and character requirements
Non‑accompanying family may also need to meet these requirements
newborn_children: Must notify the department before lodging application
Cannot lodge online if child’s visa is not linked to their passport

costs.additional_family_member_costs: Additional charge per family member applying

second_instalment_charge.applies_to: Family unit applicants 18 or older with less than functional English
second_instalment_charge.payment_condition: Paid only when requested, only if visa is to be granted

costs.pricing_tool_note: Visa Pricing Estimator does not include second instalment or other costs

processing_times.note: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times; not specific to individual applications.
factors_affecting_processing: Speed of applicant responses to requests
Time required for checks on information provided
External agency response times (health, character, national security)
Number of places available in the migration program

obligations: Visa holder and family must follow Australian laws

travel.travel_rights: Unlimited travel in and out of Australia for 5 years from visa grant
travel.after_5_years: Resident Return Visa (RRV) required to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to passport; no physical label provided

child_pages.title: Skilled Work Regional (Provisional) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the Skilled Work Regional (Provisional) visa (subclass 491), including eligibility requirements, conditions, costs, and processing time details. It covers both main applicants and subsequent entrants who are family members of a current subclass 491 visa holder.

structured_data.description: A provisional visa for skilled people nominated by a state or territory government or sponsored by an eligible relative to live and work in regional Australia.

requirements: Be nominated to apply by a state or territory government agency, or be sponsored by an eligible relative
Have an occupation on a relevant skilled occupation list
Have a suitable skills assessment for the occupation
Be invited to apply
Satisfy the points test

main_applicant_stream.purpose: For skilled workers who want to live and work in regional Australia
benefits: Stay in Australia for 5 years
Live, work and study in a designated regional area of Australia
Travel to and from Australia as many times as desired while the visa is valid
Apply for permanent residence after 3 years from the visa grant date
main_applicant_stream.processing_time_information: Use the visa processing time guide tool to view indicative processing times for recently decided applications. The displayed times are a guide only and not specific to individual applications.

subsequent_entrant_stream.description: For members of the family unit of a person who holds a subclass 491 visa granted under the primary criteria.
eligibility: Must be a member of the family unit of a person who holds a subclass 491 visa granted on the basis of meeting primary criteria
subsequent_entrant_stream.stay_duration: Until the visa held by the family member ends
subsequent_entrant_stream.processing_time_information: Use the visa processing time guide tool to view indicative processing times for recently decided applications. The displayed times are a guide only and not specific to individual applications.

child_pages.title: Temporary Activity visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Temporary Activity visa (subclass 408), including its various streams, eligibility, costs, stay periods, and purpose. Each stream supports short‑term, activity‑based entry into Australia for work, cultural, research, entertainment and other specialised programs.

structured_data.general_description: This visa allows you to come to Australia to do specific types of work on a short-term, temporary basis.
basic_eligibility: You must have the skills to undertake the activity to be carried out in Australia.
You must be supported or sponsored.
You must meet additional requirements of the relevant stream.

streams.description: This temporary visa lets you come to Australia to participate in events endorsed by the Australian Government.
streams.stay: Duration of the event or up to 4 years depending on circumstances
streams.cost: From AUD430.00 (Free for participants of the Asian Football Confederation (AFC) Women's Asian Cup 2026 event)
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool; guide only, not specific to each application.
key_points: Only for participation in certain events endorsed by the Australian Government
Stay is for the event duration or up to 4 years

streams.description: This visa lets you stay in Australia to take part in an approved special program, including youth exchange, cultural enrichment, community programs, school language assistants or gap year school volunteering.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Take part in a special program to exchange culture, knowledge and social experiences
Stay for usually up to 12 months with family members
Apply inside or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This visa lets you do full-time religious work for a religious institution in Australia.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Do full-time religious work to serve a religious institution
Stay up to 2 years with family members
Apply inside or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This visa lets you observe or take part in a research project at a research or tertiary institution in Australia.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Observe or take part in an Australian research project
Stay up to 2 years with family members
Apply inside or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.stream_name: Invited for Other Social and Cultural Activity (Invited Participant)
streams.description: This visa lets you come to Australia if you are invited to participate in a community-based event, including sporting events.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Must have been invited to take part in a community-based event
Stay up to 3 months with family members
Apply in or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This visa allows you to play, coach, instruct or adjudicate for an Australian team, or do high level sports training with a sporting organisation.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Play, coach, instruct or adjudicate for a team, or do high-level sports training
Stay up to 2 years with family members
Apply in or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This temporary visa lets you come to Australia to work in the entertainment industry on film, television or live productions as a performer, production or support staff.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Work on film, television or live productions
Stay up to 2 years with family members
Apply in or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This visa lets you work in Australia as a crew member of a superyacht.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Work as a superyacht crew member
Stay up to 12 months
Apply in or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This visa lets you come to Australia as part of a staff exchange with an Australian organisation.
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Participate in a staff exchange program
Stay up to 2 years with family members
Apply in or outside Australia, but not in immigration clearance

streams.description: This visa lets you come to Australia to do full-time domestic work in the household of certain senior foreign executives.
streams.stay: Up to the duration permitted (information truncated)
streams.cost: Not fully provided in the text
streams.processing_time_note: Processing time information available via the visa processing time guide tool.
key_points: Do full-time domestic work for senior foreign executives
Stay permitted for you and family members (full details truncated)

child_pages.title: Temporary Graduate visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Temporary Graduate visa (subclass 485), including available streams, eligibility criteria, stay periods, costs and conditions. It outlines three different streams and what international graduates must meet to qualify.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa that allows international students to live, study and work in Australia after finishing their studies.

requirements: Be aged 35 years or under when applying (exceptions apply)
Hold an eligible visa
Have held a Student visa in the last 6 months
Have a recent qualification in a CRICOS-registered course
Apply for an eligible stream (stream cannot be changed after applying)
Attach required evidence when applying
notes: Information available for employers looking to hire a Temporary Graduate visa holder
English language testing requirements changed from 7 August 2025
related_links: English language requirements for Australian visa purposes have changed

streams.description: For international students who recently graduated with an associate degree, diploma or trade qualification relevant to an occupation Australia needs.
benefits: You can work in Australia
You can bring your family with you
requirements: Must hold a qualification relevant to your nominated occupation on the skilled occupation list
Qualification must be an associate degree, diploma or trade qualification meeting the Temporary Graduate visa study requirement
streams.stay: Up to 18 months. Hong Kong and British National Overseas passport holders may stay for 5 years.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times (not specific to your application).

streams.description: For international students who recently graduated with a degree from an Australian institution.
benefits: You can work in Australia
You can bring your family with you
requirements: Need a recent degree in a CRICOS-registered course
Must meet the Temporary Graduate visa study requirement with a degree-level qualification or higher
streams.stay: Usually between 2 and 3 years, depending on qualification. Hong Kong and British National Overseas passport holders may stay for 5 years.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times (not specific to your application).

streams.description: For Temporary Graduates holding a Post-Higher Education Work, Post-Study Work or Replacement visa with a degree from an Australian institution located in a regional area.
benefits: You can work in Australia
You can bring your family with you
streams.stay: Between 1 and 2 years depending on: the regional location of the educational institution that issued the qualification for the first Temporary Graduate visa and the regional area the applicant lives in while holding the qualifying visa.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for indicative processing times (not specific to your application).

child_pages.title: Temporary Work (International Relations) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) and its multiple streams. It outlines each stream's purpose, eligibility, stay periods, costs, and key conditions. The visa supports international relations through various work arrangements under formal agreements, government agency roles, diplomatic domestic work, privileges and immunities, labour mobility, and the MATES program.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa to work in specific circumstances that improve Australia’s international relations.
structured_data.basic_eligibility: Each stream has specific eligibility requirements.

streams.purpose: Allows a person to work in Australia under the terms and conditions of a bilateral agreement between the Australian Government or a state/territory government and a government of another country.
streams.stay: You can stay until the time specified in the visa grant notice, up to 4 years.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent application decisions. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.
eligibility_requirements: Be employed or engaged under the terms and conditions of a bilateral agreement between the Australian Government or a state/territory government and another country
Stay in Australia for up to 4 years
Apply for the visa in or outside Australia

streams.purpose: Allows a person to come to Australia for specific activities, including working as a representative of a foreign government agency or as a foreign language teacher employed by a foreign government in an Australian school.
streams.stay: You can stay until the time specified in your visa grant notice, which may be up to 4 years.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent application decisions. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.
eligibility_requirements: You can work as a representative of a foreign government agency that does not enjoy official status in Australia (provided that you would not, as a representative, enjoy official status in Australia)
You can work as a foreign language teacher employed by a foreign government in an Australian school
You can apply for the visa in or outside Australia, but not from immigration clearance

streams.purpose: Allows a person aged 18 years or older to do temporary full-time domestic work in Australia in the household of someone who holds a Diplomatic (Temporary) visa (subclass 995).
streams.stay: Up to 12 months on the first visa. A further Domestic Worker stream visa allows stay for the time specified in the DFAT support letter.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent application decisions. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.
eligibility_requirements: Do full-time domestic work in the household of someone who holds a Diplomatic (Temporary) visa (subclass 995)
Must be outside Australia the first time you apply and when the application is decided

streams.purpose: Allows a person to come to Australia if they have, or expect to have, privileges and immunities under relevant legislation.
streams.stay: Stay for the time specified in the visa grant letter, usually the time you are an international representative with DFAT support.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent application decisions. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.
eligibility_requirements: You can stay in Australia while working as an international representative
Position must have, or expect to have, privileges and immunities under relevant legislation
A letter of support from DFAT is required

streams.purpose: Allows a person to come to Australia to participate in the Pacific Australia Labour Mobility (PALM) scheme.
streams.stay: Stay until the time specified in the visa grant notice, which may be up to 4 years.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent application decisions. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.
eligibility_requirements: Be a citizen and resident of a participating PALM scheme country
Be sponsored by a temporary activities sponsor approved by the Department of Employment and Workplace Relations (DEWR) as a PALM scheme employer
Work under the PALM scheme for up to 9 months under a short-term work contract
Work under the PALM scheme for up to 4 years under a long-term work contract

streams.stream_name: Mobility Arrangement for Talented Early-professionals Scheme (MATES)
streams.purpose: Allows Indian graduates and early career professionals to live and work in Australia for up to 2 years. Applicants must be selected in a ballot to apply.
streams.stay: You can stay in Australia for up to 2 years.
streams.processing_time: Use the visa processing time guide tool for recent application decisions. It is a guide only and not specific to your application.

child_pages.title: Temporary Work (Short Stay Specialist) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Temporary Work (Short Stay Specialist) visa, Subclass 400. It outlines who is eligible, how long the visa allows you to stay, costs, requirements, obligations, and work limitations. It also explains application steps, entry rules, and conditions for including family members.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa that allows short-term, highly specialised, non-ongoing work in Australia when the required skills are not reasonably available in Australia.

stay_information.requirement_for_over_3_months: strong business case must be provided
stay_information.must_arrive_within: 6 months of visa grant date or shorter period specified by the Minister

visa_entry_types.single_entry: Holder may enter Australia once; must apply for a new visa to return.
visa_entry_types.multiple_entry: Holder may re-enter multiple times but stay period does not restart.

exceptions: Applicants coming to Australia as a representative of a foreign government listed in a legislative instrument
additional_costs: Charges for each family member applying
costs.pricing_tool: Visa Pricing Estimator (does not include additional costs)

processing_times.processing_time_guide: Use visa processing time guide tool for recent decision times. Not specific to individual cases.

conditions: Work must match the purpose for which the visa was granted
not_allowed_work: perform as an entertainer in Australia
support an entertainer or group performing in Australia
direct or produce work for entertainment shown in Australia (unless meeting exemptions)
allowed_entertainment_activities_with_co: directing, producing, or roles in a production not shown in Australia (requires distribution contract or evidence)
promotional activities (e.g., actor at premiere, band on promotional tour with no performances)

must_have: skills, knowledge or experience that can assist Australian business
skills not reasonably available in the Australian labour market
work that is non-ongoing (completed within 6 months or less)
evidence_examples: letter from overseas employer explaining position and duties
highly_specialised_skills_requirement.employer_requirements: Australian business or overseas employer may need to show they attempted to hire Australians first

requirements_for_family: not permitted to work or study (except language training)
family_members.financial_requirements: Applicant must show enough means to support themselves and family

health_insurance.recommendation: Take out health insurance for unforeseen medical treatment
health_insurance.personal_liability: You are responsible for all healthcare costs in Australia
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare_agreements: Some countries have agreements; see Services Australia

travel.first_entry_requirement: Must enter within 6 months of visa grant unless a shorter period specified

child_pages.title: Skills in Demand
child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the Subclass 482 Skills in Demand visa. It outlines that the visa allows employers to sponsor skilled overseas workers when suitably skilled Australians are not available. The content includes a brief description and the basic eligibility criteria applicants must meet.

structured_data.description: This temporary visa lets an employer sponsor a suitably skilled worker to fill a position they can’t find a suitably skilled Australian to fill.

basic_eligibility_requirements: Be nominated for a skilled position by an approved sponsor
Have the right skills to do the job
Meet the relevant English language requirements

child_pages.title: Global Special Humanitarian visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 202 Global Special Humanitarian visa, which allows eligible individuals facing human rights abuses to resettle permanently in Australia. It explains eligibility, costs, processing priorities, obligations, family inclusion rules, and the application process (including mandatory use of ImmiAccount from 1 July 2025).

structured_data.description: A permanent visa for people facing substantial human rights violations and who have a connection to Australia or are joining an immediate family member.

from_1_july_2025_changes.process: Proposer must complete the proposal first and provide the transaction reference number (TRN). Applicant must use the TRN within 60 days to apply in ImmiAccount.

key_features: Propose certain family members for permanent residence
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
If eligible, become an Australian citizen
Attend free English classes through the Adult Migrant English Program

general_requirements: Must have a proposer
Must enter Australia by the date on the visa
You and accompanying family must obey Australian laws

how_long_you_can_stay.details: You become a permanent resident on the day you enter Australia on this visa.

allowed_family_members: Other dependent relatives (parent, grandparent, sibling, grandchild, aunt, uncle, niece, nephew, cousin)
requirements: Family members who apply must meet health and character requirements
Non-migrating family members may need to meet health requirements
All family members must be declared
Undeclared family members may not be eligible for later humanitarian sponsorship

cost.exception: A fee applies if proposed under the Community Support Program by an Approved Proposing Organisation

structured_data.apply_from: You must be outside Australia and outside your country of origin.

important_notes: More applications are received each year than available places
processing_can_be_delayed_if: Documents are missing or additional information is required

priority_groups.note: SHP applications are processed in order of priority group.

groups.description: Proposer is an immediate family member who holds or held a Protection or Resolution of Status visa or a Class XB visa, and the applicant meets split-family criteria.

child_pages.title: Protection visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 866 Protection visa for people who legally arrived in Australia and seek asylum. It outlines eligibility, costs, processing, family inclusion rules, obligations, travel conditions, and rights granted by the visa. The visa allows permanent stay if Australia’s protection obligations are engaged.

visa_details.description: Permanent visa for people who arrived in Australia on a valid visa and seek asylum. Grants permanent stay if Australia’s protection obligations are engaged.

Attend free English language classes if eligible

notes: Processing is complex and may take some time.
Applicants can assist by responding quickly to information requests.

Must have arrived legally in Australia holding a valid visa.
Must meet health, character and security requirements.

All must be eligible to apply

Usually lives with the family head
Wholly or substantially reliant on the family head for support

child_pages.title: Temporary Protection visa

child_pages.title: Resolution of Status
child_pages.summary: This page provides comprehensive information about the Resolution of Status (RoS) visa, Subclass 851, which offers permanent residence to certain TPV and SHEV visa holders who arrived in Australia before 14 February 2023. It outlines eligibility, application processes, requirements, benefits, and special conditions for current visa holders and those with existing applications.

structured_data.description: A permanent visa allowing TPV and SHEV holders who arrived in Australia before 14 February 2023 to obtain permanent residency.
key_points: Provides permanent residence to eligible TPV and SHEV holders.
Free visa application assistance is available.
No fee charged by the Department of Home Affairs; fast‑tracking services are scams.
Applications must be submitted before TPV or SHEV expiry.
Permanent residency enables access to services and pathways to citizenship.
benefits: Live, work and study in Australia permanently
Access Services Australia benefits and Medicare
Access Centrelink services
Access short-term counselling for torture and trauma
Sponsor eligible family members for permanent residence
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Become an Australian citizen if eligible
Attend English language classes for free

Status Resolution Service is available for assistance.

Applicants aged 18 or over must sign the Australian Values Statement
May be asked to provide additional identity information or attend an interview if needed

child_pages.title: Bridging visa A (BVA)
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Bridging visa A (subclass 010), including what it allows, eligibility, conditions, validity rules, and how it interacts with substantive visa applications and judicial review processes. It also explains work permissions, when the visa comes into effect, when it ends, and who can be included in an application.

structured_data.description: This temporary visa generally allows a person to stay in Australia after their current substantive visa ceases and while their new substantive visa application is being processed.

methods: Online webform (required for judicial review-related BVA applications)

restrictions.travel: BVA does not permit return travel to Australia.

details: Renew passport before carrier registers for CTA
CTA is linked to passport; must use same passport to travel

steps.title: Gather your documents
documents_needed: Valid Airline Identity Card or ICAO Safety Inspector Certificate

aircraft_safety_inspectors: Granted Special Purpose visa for 30 days from disembarkation
Must hold valid government identity document or ICAO certificate
Must be included in crew list provided by or for the carrier
special_rules.air_crew_documents: Airline crew members granted Special Purpose visa for 30 days (content truncated)

child_pages.title: Former Resident visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Former Resident visa (subclass 151). It explains who is eligible, what the visa allows, application requirements, costs, obligations, and travel rules. The visa is intended for former Australian permanent residents and certain former members of the Australian Defence Force.

structured_data.description: This permanent visa allows former permanent residents and certain people who served in the Australian Defence Force to live in Australia.
benefits: Stay in Australia permanently
Work and study in Australia
Enrol in Australia's public health care scheme, Medicare
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Travel to and from Australia for up to 5 years from date of grant while travel facility remains valid
Apply for Australian citizenship if eligible

permanent_residency_start: Date of visa grant if applicant is in Australia
Date of entry into Australia on this visa if applicant is outside Australia at time of grant

criteria: If 18 years or older: spent at least 9 years in Australia as a permanent resident before turning 18
If under 18: spent at least half of life in Australia as a permanent resident
Younger than 45 years of age at time of application
Maintained close business, cultural, or personal ties with Australia after ceasing to be a permanent resident
Completed at least 3 months of continuous Australian defence service
Discharged from Australian Defence Force before 3 months of service due to being medically unfit because of defence service
defence_service_requirement.age_requirement: No age requirement for defence services pathway

health_requirement.applies_to: All applicants and family members applying with the main applicant
notes: Family members applying from outside Australia who are not migrating may also need to meet the requirement
Family members applying from outside Australia who are not migrating may also need to meet the requirement

eligibility.debt_to_government: All debts to the Australian Government must be repaid or arrangements made
visa_history_conditions: Past visa cancellations or refusals may affect eligibility
Some exceptions apply for applying from inside or outside Australia

requirements: Family members must meet health and character requirements
Family outside Australia not migrating may also need to meet requirements
family_inclusion.newborn_child: Special instructions apply for children born after application submission

costs.family_member_cost: Additional fee per family member applies

restrictions: Cannot apply in immigration clearance
If applying in Australia, applicant must be in Australia at time of decision
If applying outside Australia, applicant must be outside Australia at time of decision

notes: Processing times are indicative only
Application may take longer if incomplete, missing documents, or if verification takes time
Incorrect fee payment prevents processing

obligations: Applicant and family members must obey all Australian laws

travel.initial_travel_facility: 5 years from date of visa grant
travel_rules: Unlimited travel during the 5-year travel validity
After validity expires, an RRV is required to return to Australia as a permanent resident
Australian citizenship removes need for visa to return
important_notes: If outside Australia when travel validity expires, cannot return without RRV
Maximum RRV travel period for those not meeting residence requirement is 12 months by law
Permanent residents in Australia do not need RRV unless they wish to travel

visa_label.details: Visa is digitally linked to passport

related_links: Who can help with your visa application

child_pages.title: Maritime Crew visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Maritime Crew visa (Subclass 988), which allows foreign crew members of eligible ships and their accompanying family members to enter Australia by sea. It outlines eligibility, permitted activities, ship eligibility, visa conditions, costs, processing times, and rules for staying, traveling, and including family members.

structured_data.description: This visa allows foreign crew on a Maritime Crew visa (MCV) eligible ship to enter Australia by sea during an international voyage. It is also available to the partner or dependent child of a foreign crew member when travelling on the same ship.

stay.general_rule: You can stay in Australia as long as you are a crew member of a Maritime Crew Visa eligible ship that is in Australia.
stay.maximum_duration: Visa lasts for 3 years unless ceased earlier.
reasons_for_visa_ceasing: Attempting to enter or work in Australia on an ineligible ship
Performing work not related to normal operational duties of the ship
Arriving by air and failing to sign on to your ship within 5 days or before another visa ceases
Signing off your ship and failing to leave Australia, obtain another visa, or join another eligible ship within 5 days (or another specified period)
Ship imported for sale and not registered, or registration ceases, and crew does not leave Australia or join another eligible ship within 5 days
Leaving a vessel after arrival in Australia without being immigration‑cleared
Holding another visa that is cancelled for a reason other than character grounds
The department determining it is undesirable for the applicant to continue holding an MCV

processing_times.note: Processing times are available through the visa processing time guide tool and are indicative only.

with_this_visa_you_can: Arrive and depart Australia by sea as a crew member of an MCV eligible ship
Stay in Australia for as long as you are signed on as a crew member of an MCV eligible ship
Sign off a ship to join another MCV eligible ship or to leave Australia
Perform only work that meets the normal operational duties of a crew member
with_this_visa_you_cannot: Enter Australia by air using only this visa
Enter Australia by sea on an ineligible ship
Stay as a visitor, tourist, or permanent resident solely on this visa
Work in Australia in tasks unrelated to the operational duties of the ship
Bypass Australia's health and quarantine requirements

requirements: Must be outside Australia when applying
Must comply with Australia’s health and quarantine requirements
Must be a crew member, or have an offer to be a crew member, on an MCV eligible ship on an international voyage
Must not be a crew member on ineligible ships such as most fishing vessels, yachts, private research vessels, or superyachts
Must not be an Australian citizen or permanent visa holder

eligible_ships: Cargo ships carrying goods between Australia and overseas ports
International cruise ships with paying passengers
Foreign government owned and operated research ships
Ships with Public Vessel Status from the Australian Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade
Ships imported under the Australian Customs Act 1901 and registered on the Australian International Shipping Register
ineligible_ships: Small marine craft, yachts, and superyachts
Petroleum export tankers that visit both offshore resource areas and an Australian port on the same trip
Foreign research vessels not owned and operated by a foreign government

apply_from.application_location: Must be outside Australia when applying
apply_from.decision_location: Can be inside or outside Australia when the visa is decided
apply_from.travel_warning: Must not travel to Australia without a visa

stay_longer.rule: You cannot apply for a new Maritime Crew visa while in Australia.
stay_longer.requirement: Must apply for another visa before the current one ceases.

include_family.who_can_apply: Members of the family unit travelling on the same ship with permission from the vessel master
include_family.application_requirements: Each family member must lodge a separate application
visa_ceases_if: Family enters Australia without the primary applicant and holds no other valid visa
Family stops travelling with the crew member and does not leave Australia or obtain another visa
include_family.work_restrictions: Family members are not permitted to work in Australia

travel.allowed: Can enter Australia by sea as many times as the visa remains valid
travel.not_allowed: Cannot enter Australia by air using only the Maritime Crew visa

your_obligations.general: Must meet all visa conditions and obey Australian laws

health_insurance.liability: Applicants are personally liable for all healthcare costs in Australia
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare: Some countries have reciprocal healthcare agreements with Australia

visa_label.note: Visa is digitally linked to the applicant's passport

child_pages.title: Medical Treatment visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Medical Treatment visa (Subclass 602), a temporary Australian visa for individuals seeking medical treatment, organ donation, or supporting someone undergoing treatment. It outlines visa conditions, eligibility criteria, costs, stay periods, obligations, and application requirements.

structured_data.description: A temporary visa for people to travel to or remain longer in Australia for medical treatment, to donate an organ, or to support someone receiving medical treatment or donating an organ.

stay.duration_determination: Determined on a case-by-case basis depending on treatment plan
stay.stay_longer_information: Must apply for another visa if more time is needed

notes: Times shown are based on recently decided applications
Times are indicative only and not specific to an individual application
factors_that_delay_processing: Non-payment of the correct visa application charge

what_you_can_do: Have medical treatment or consultation
Donate an organ
Support someone who holds this visa who is an organ donor or receiving medical treatment
Be granted single or multiple entry depending on situation
Study for up to 3 months (or longer if meeting exemption criteria)

situational_requirements: Intend to have medical treatment or consultation in Australia
Intend to donate an organ to someone in Australia
Intend to support a patient or organ donor who holds this visa
Intend to receive an organ from someone traveling to Australia with the applicant
Intend to come under arrangements between the Western Province of Papua New Guinea and the Queensland Department of Health
Be in Australia, aged 50 or older, refused a permanent visa on health grounds only, and be unfit to depart Australia
eligibility.health_threat_restriction: Must not have a medical condition that could be a threat to public health or endanger the community

visa_holding_restriction.must_not_hold: Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) in the Domestic Worker (Diplomatic or Consular) stream
visa_holding_restriction.exceptions: Applicants aged 50+ assessed as unfit to depart after permanent visa refusal on health grounds

financial_capacity.requirement: Must have adequate means to support oneself in Australia
must_cover: Expenses of accompanying persons, including organ donors

must_intend_to: Only undertake activities allowed on this visa
exceptions: Applicants in Australia aged 50 or older, refused a permanent visa for health reasons, and unfit to depart

debt_to_government.requirement: Must have repaid or arranged repayment of debts to the Australian Government

medical_payment_arrangement.requirement: In most cases, must pre-arrange payment of medical costs

support_persons.definition: A family member or another person such as a friend who applies to support the visa applicant
requirements: Must file a separate application unless included in applicant’s passport
Applications can be processed together
Applicant’s visa must be granted before support person's visa

obligations: Comply with all visa conditions
Obey Australian laws

health_insurance.recommendation: Strongly recommended to obtain health insurance for unforeseen medical treatment
health_insurance.liability: Applicant is personally liable for all healthcare costs
health_insurance.adequate_insurance_reference: Information available on what counts as adequate insurance
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare: Some countries have reciprocal agreements; information available via Services Australia

requirements: Must arrive before visa expiry
travel_conditions.multiple_entry: Can leave and re-enter as many times as desired

single_entry.if_granted_outside_australia: Can enter Australia once; cannot return if departing
single_entry.if_granted_in_australia: Can leave and return once; cannot return after second departure

travel_conditions.verification: Entry type can be checked in VEVO or visa grant letter

visa_label.description: Visa is digitally linked to passport

additional_information.help_with_visa: Applicants should read about who can help with visa applications before paying anyone

child_pages.title: Resident Return visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Resident Return Visa (RRV), subclasses 155 and 157, which allows eligible people to re-enter Australia as permanent residents. It explains eligibility, costs, travel facility duration, application requirements, and important conditions for maintaining permanent resident travel rights.

structured_data.purpose: Allows permanent residents, former permanent residents, or former citizens to return to Australia as permanent residents.
key_points: If your travel facility expires while you are outside Australia, you cannot return as a permanent resident without an RRV.
Unlimited number of RRVs can be applied for.
Australian citizens are not eligible to apply.
Cannot extend or postpone an RRV travel facility.
Travel facility expiry reminders are sent for Subclass 155 holders unless an application is pending.

who_can_apply: Former Australian permanent residents whose last permanent visa was not cancelled
Former Australian citizens who lost or renounced citizenship
notes: If already in Australia as a permanent resident and not travelling, you do not need an RRV.
Applicants with substantial ties may be eligible even without meeting residence requirements.

with_this_visa_you_can: Travel to and from Australia as a permanent resident until the travel facility expires
Hold a travel facility of up to 5 years depending on personal circumstances

refund_policy: Refunds generally not given if application is refused
Refunds not given if travel facility on previous visa is lost after RRV grant
Refunds not given if travel facility is unused
If the department caused the applicant to lodge an RRV in error, a refund may be considered with evidence

travel_facility_duration.five_year_travel_facility: Given if applicant was in Australia for at least 2 years in the last 5 years as a permanent resident or Australian citizen
twelve_month_travel_facility: For applicants who have substantial ties of benefit to Australia but do not meet residence requirements
For family members applying as part of a family unit with a person who qualifies
travel_facility_duration.three_month_travel_facility_subclass_157: Given if compelling and compassionate reasons for departure exist and applicant has not been absent from Australia in the 5 years before lodging
rules: Remaining travel facility does not carry over to a new RRV
Cannot postpone visa grant once criteria are met

include_family.processing_together: Separate family applications can be processed together if declared
include_family.information_required: Immediate family members who are Australian citizens or permanent residents should be listed to demonstrate substantial ties

apply_from.location: You can be in or outside Australia but not in immigration clearance
apply_from.paper_application: Only allowed if authorised; instructions must be followed
apply_from.urgent_travel: If travel is needed urgently and visa is not yet granted, applicants are directed to contact the department

processing_times.note: Processing time guide tool gives indicative times based on recent applications; not specific to individual applications
processing_times.additional_details: Content truncated, but it states that applications meeting residence requirements are generally processed faster

obligations_and_conditions.check_travel_facility: Applicants should verify the travel facility expiry on VEVO
consequences_of_returning_without_valid_: May affect ability to meet permanent residence requirements for citizenship or future RRVs
when_not_to_apply: If in Australia, travel facility expired, and no travel is planned

related_links: Information on who can help with visa application
Overseas travel as a permanent resident

child_pages.title: Special Category visa (SCV)
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Subclass 444 Special Category visa (SCV) for New Zealand citizens. It explains what the visa allows, eligibility requirements, application steps, obligations, costs, and related conditions. It also includes travel rules, health guidance, and details on behaviour and health concern assessments.

structured_data.description: This visa allows eligible New Zealand citizens to visit, study, stay, and work in Australia. It is usually applied for each time the holder enters Australia.

stay_duration.validity: From grant until the holder leaves Australia
visa_ceases_when: The holder becomes an Australian citizen
stay_duration.reapplication_note: A new SCV is required each time the New Zealand citizen re-enters Australia.

processing_times.on_arrival: Processed at the airport or seaport
processing_times.onshore_application: May take longer depending on individual circumstances

what_you_can_do: Enter and stay in Australia as long as you remain a New Zealand citizen
Visit, work, and study in Australia
Apply for a permanent visa if eligible

general_requirements: Must remain a New Zealand citizen
Must continue to meet character requirements
eligibility.passport_requirement: Must have a valid New Zealand passport

behaviour_concern_non_citizen.description: You may be refused an SCV or refused entry into Australia if assessed as a BCNC.
criteria: Convicted of a crime with a sentence of death or at least one year imprisonment
Convicted of two or more crimes resulting in total imprisonment of at least one year
Charged with and found guilty of a crime while of unsound mind (including being found not guilty due to unsound mind)
Previously removed or deported from Australia
Previously removed, deported, or excluded from another country
behaviour_concern_non_citizen.notes: Imprisonment includes confinement in a corrective institution.
behaviour_concern_non_citizen.pre‑travel_check: Travellers may check eligibility via the online webform: Enquiry Form – New Zealand passport holders travelling with a criminal conviction

health_concern_non_citizen.description: You may be assessed as a health concern non-citizen if you declare tuberculosis (TB) on entry.
health_concern_non_citizen.requirements: If TB is declared, additional information will be requested.

eligibility.no_further_stay_condition: You cannot apply for this visa if your current visa includes a 'no further stay' condition.

include_family.requirement: Each family member must make their own SCV application.
how_to_apply: Show a valid New Zealand passport
Submit a completed incoming passenger card
Answer health and character questions at SmartGate if applicable
include_family.non_nz_citizen_family: Family members who are not New Zealand citizens must apply for a different visa.

application_process.typical_process: Usually applied for on entry to Australia.
onshore_application_possible_if: The person became a New Zealand citizen and passport holder after entering Australia
The person entered on a passport that is not a New Zealand passport
The person entered on another temporary visa
A New Zealand citizen baby was born in Australia
application_process.onshore_application_method: Apply via the provided online form.
application_process.grant_date_note: If granted onshore, the grant date is the date of decision and cannot be backdated.

child_born_on_or_before_30_june_2022.requirement: Child must be registered as a New Zealand citizen and receive a citizenship certificate and/or passport.
child_born_on_or_before_30_june_2022.application_note: After obtaining NZ documents, submit an onshore SCV application via the Onshore visa application form.

child_born_on_or_after_1_july_2022.note: Child may automatically acquire Australian citizenship by law at birth.
child_born_on_or_after_1_july_2022.next_step: Child can apply for proof of citizenship.

application_process.check_existing_visa: Use VEVO to check if you already hold a visa.
application_process.vevo_access_requirement: A reference number is required to access VEVO.

obligations.citizenship_requirement: You must remain a New Zealand citizen. The SCV will cease if citizenship changes.
obligations.lawful_status_requirement: If the SCV ceases, you must apply for and be granted another visa to remain lawful.
obligations.character_requirements: All visa holders must continue to meet character requirements; failure may result in cancellation.

health_insurance.recommendation: It is recommended to take out health insurance to cover unforeseen medical treatment.
health_insurance.financial_liability_note: You may be responsible for your own healthcare costs.
additional_information: Learn what is considered adequate health insurance
Learn about health insurance for overseas visitors
Learn about Medicare for New Zealand citizens
health_insurance.reciprocal_healthcare: Some countries have reciprocal healthcare agreements with Australia; see Services Australia for details.

travel.travel_limitation: You cannot leave Australia and return on this visa; the visa ceases upon departure.
travel.reentry_note: A new SCV must be applied for upon return to Australia.

permanent_visa_holders.instruction: If holding a permanent visa with a valid travel facility, inform authorities if you do not want an SCV.
permanent_visa_holders.risk: Being granted an SCV unintentionally may affect eligibility for a Resident Return visa.

visa_label.note: The visa is digitally linked to the passport; no physical label is provided.

child_pages.title: Investor Retirement visa (subclass 405)
child_pages.summary: This page provides detailed information about the Investor Retirement visa (subclass 405), which is a temporary visa for self‑funded retirees. The visa is closed to new applicants but includes a pathway to permanent residence for eligible holders. It outlines requirements, eligibility criteria, costs, sponsorship details, documents, and obligations for current and former visa holders.

visa_details.description: For self-funded retirees with no dependents who wish to live in Australia during retirement.
what_this_visa_lets_you_do: Work in Australia for up to 40 hours per fortnight
Travel to and remain in Australia for four years from the grant date (renewal required after expiry)
Have an eligible partner accompany you if they are also granted this visa

who_can_apply: Former subclass 405 holders who have not held another substantive visa since last entering Australia

costs.second_visa_application_charge: Payable per applicant, required for each grant including renewals

sponsorship.requirement: Must be sponsored by an Australian state or territory government agency (excluding Australian Capital Territory)

designated_investment.requirement: Must be maintained for the duration of the visa
reapplication_rules: Amount decreases by AUD 250,000 the first time you reapply and then remains constant
If reapplying, designated investment of AUD 500,000 must be made and maintained
If living in regional Australia, designated investment of AUD 250,000 must be maintained

income_requirements.minimum_net_income_general: AUD 65,000 per year (individual or combined with partner)
income_requirements.minimum_net_income_regional: AUD 50,000 per year (individual or combined with partner)
notes: Income test applies at each visa application
Applicants must show continuing ability to meet income thresholds when reapplying

general_rules: Health examination results valid for 12 months
Applies to applicant and any dependent family members
Health examinations can be arranged before lodging
Applicants aged 16+ may need to provide police certificates from each country lived in for 12+ months in the past 10 years
Applicants must wait for instruction before arranging police certificates

health_insurance.requirement: Must provide evidence of adequate health insurance for applicant and partner
adequacy_criteria: 85% coverage for hospital, emergency, and GP services
insurer_notes: Overseas insurers may be accepted but require detailed individual assessment and may delay processing
Failure to maintain adequate insurance may result in refusal of future visas

biometrics.requirement: Applicants may be asked to provide biometrics

compelling_and_compassionate_circumstanc.purpose: Provides alternative requirements for applicants in Australia applying for a further subclass 405 visa who cannot meet certain criteria
examples: Hardship due to ailments associated with ageing
Difficulties following the death of a partner
compelling_and_compassionate_circumstanc.process: Department may request additional information after application lodgement

debts_to_government.requirement: Applicants must have no outstanding debts to the Australian Government or must have arranged repayment

rules: Applicant and partner must have valid passports
New passports should be obtained before applying
If a new passport is issued after lodging, details must be provided to the Department

general_notes: Provide certified copies of original documents unless originals are specifically requested
Documents not in English must include accredited English translations

forms.description: Application for a temporary visa for retirees

assistance_forms.description: Advice by a migration agent/exempt person of providing immigration assistance
Appointment or withdrawal of an authorised recipient

identity_documents: Certified copies of biographical passport pages for all applicants
Two recent passport-sized photographs (45 mm x 35 mm) for each applicant

child_pages.title: Business Owner (subclass 890) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the Business Owner (subclass 890) visa, which permanently closed to new applications on 22 March 2025. It explains visa conditions, travel rights, obligations, and what visa holders must do if their circumstances change.

structured_data.visa_description: A permanent visa allowing holders to stay in Australia indefinitely and travel for 5 years from the date of grant.

rights: travel to and from Australia for 5 years from visa grant date
use VEVO to check visa details and entitlements

visa_duration.travel_facility_duration: 5 years from date of visa grant
travel_facility_conditions: Unlimited travel to and from Australia within the 5-year travel facility validity
Must check VEVO to confirm travel facility end date
after_travel_facility_expires: Apply for and be granted a Resident Return visa to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Consider applying for Australian citizenship to re-enter Australia as a citizen
visa_duration.citizenship_note: Australian citizens do not require a visa to enter Australia. They must apply for an Australian passport to leave and re-enter the country.

rights_for_holder_and_dependents: carry out business activity in Australia
sponsor relatives to come to Australia
travel to and from Australia for 5 years
apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible

general_obligations: meet all visa conditions
obey Australian laws

must_notify_changes: changes to phone number, email, address or passport
change_of_details_requirements.consequences_of_not_updating_passport: Significant delays at the airport and possible denial of permission to board a plane.

child_pages.title: Investor (subclass 891) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides official information about the Investor (subclass 891) visa, which is a permanent visa that closed to new applications on 22 March 2025. It explains what the visa allows, how long it lasts, travel facility conditions, and obligations for visa holders.

visa_information.description: A permanent visa allowing holders to stay in Australia indefinitely and travel for 5 years from the grant date.

travel_notes: Allows unlimited travel to and from Australia for 5 years as long as the travel facility is valid.
After the initial 5-year travel facility ends, visa holders must apply for a Resident Return visa to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident.
entitlements.vevo_information: Visa holders can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check visa details and entitlements.

notes: Becoming an Australian citizen removes the need for a visa to enter Australia.
Australian citizens must apply for and use an Australian passport when leaving or re-entering Australia.

allowed_activities: Stay in Australia permanently
Work and study in Australia
Carry out business and investment activity in Australia
Enrol in Australia’s public health care scheme, Medicare
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years
Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible

general_obligations: Meet all visa conditions
Obey Australian laws

required_notifications: Changes to phone number, email, address, or passport
change_notification_requirements.consequence_of_not_updating_passport: May experience significant delays at the airport and may be denied permission to board a plane.

important_links_referenced.citizenship_information: See more about eligibility requirements and current processing times for Australian citizenship
important_links_referenced.change_of_details: See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation

child_pages.title: State or Territory Sponsored Business Owner (subclass 892) visa
child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the State or Territory Sponsored Business Owner (subclass 892) visa, which closed to new applications on 22 March 2025. It describes what the visa allows, how long it lasts, obligations of visa holders, and what changes must be reported to the authorities.

structured_data.visa_name: State or Territory Sponsored Business Owner visa

visa_holder_information.description: This is a permanent visa that allows the holder to stay in Australia indefinitely.

travel_facility.conditions: Allows unlimited travel to and from Australia as long as the travel facility remains valid
travel_facility.checking_travel_facility: Use VEVO to check travel facility end date

post_travel_facility_options: Apply for and be granted a Resident Return visa to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Consider becoming an Australian citizen to re-enter Australia without a visa

citizenship_information.note: Australian citizens do not require a visa to enter Australia
citizenship_information.requirement: Must apply for an Australian passport after gaining citizenship

entitlements.description: This visa allows the holder and their dependent family members who also hold a subclass 892 visa to:
activities_permitted: Carry out business activity in Australia

Sponsor relatives to come to Australia

child_pages.summary: This page provides information about the State or Territory Sponsored Investor (subclass 893) visa, which closed to new applications on 22 March 2025. It outlines what the visa allows, how long it lasts, obligations for visa holders, and what changes must be reported to the authorities.

structured_data.visa_name: State or Territory Sponsored Investor visa
structured_data.description: A permanent visa for state or territory sponsored investors, allowing holders to stay indefinitely in Australia.

entitlements: Stay in Australia indefinitely
Travel to and from Australia for 5 years from the grant date
Use VEVO for free to check visa details and entitlements

travel_conditions: Unlimited travel to and from Australia for 5 years while travel facility is valid
after_travel_facility_expires: Apply for and be granted a Resident Return visa to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Consider becoming an Australian citizen to avoid needing a visa to re-enter Australia

Eligibility requirements and processing times for citizenship apply

Enrol in Medicare (Australia’s public health care scheme)

child_pages.title: Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808)
child_pages.summary: This page provides information for existing holders of the Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808), which closed to new applications on 6 February 2025. It explains visa rights, travel conditions, obligations, and guidance for permanent residents, including information on citizenship and sponsoring family members.

visa_details.description: A permanent residence visa available only to existing holders, no longer open for new applicants.

what_this_visa_lets_you_do: Stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident
Enrol in Australia’s public health care scheme
Sponsor relatives to come to Australia
Travel to and from Australia while the travel facility on the visa is valid
Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible

visa_duration_and_travel.travel_facility_validity: 5 years from the visa grant date
travel_after_expiry_requirements: Apply for and be granted a Resident Return Visa (RRV) to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
Consider applying for Australian citizenship, which removes the need for a visa to enter Australia and allows use of an Australian passport
additional_information_links: Learn how to become an Australian citizen
Information about travelling overseas as a permanent resident

instructions: Inform the immigration officer that you have a permanent Australian visa
State that you do not want a Special Category visa (subclass 444)
consequences_if_not_informed: A subclass 444 visa may be granted automatically
This may override the permanent visa
This may affect eligibility for another permanent visa and/or Australian citizenship

general_obligations: You must obey all Australian laws

notes: Failure to provide updated passport details may result in significant delays at the airport
change_of_details.how_to_notify_link: See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation

child_pages.title: Non Award Sector visa (subclass 575)
child_pages.summary: This page provides information for existing holders or pending applicants of the closed Non Award Sector visa (subclass 575). It explains what the visa allows, how long it lasts, and the obligations of students and their dependent family members. It also details rules about education provider changes, welfare requirements for minors, and reporting responsibilities.

applicable_audience: People who already hold a Non Award Sector visa (subclass 575)
People who applied for the visa on or before 30 June 2016 and are awaiting a decision

visa_validity.valid_until: Expiry date provided at time of grant

study_rights: Visa holder can study in Australia
Family members aged 18 or older can study up to 3 months; must apply for their own student visa for study exceeding 3 months (can apply in Australia)

visa_holder: Work up to 40 hours per fortnight once course has commenced
Work unlimited hours during scheduled course breaks
Must comply with State and Territory workplace laws
family_members: Work up to 40 hours per fortnight after the visa holder has commenced their course
Eligible dependent family members can accompany the student to Australia

general_student_obligations: Comply with visa conditions or risk visa cancellation
course_change_requirements: If changing to a course in a different education sector, must apply for Student Visa (subclass 500)
Visa subclass 575 is not appropriate for different education sectors

applies_if: Visa was granted under streamlined visa processing (SVP)
requirements: Must continue to satisfy requirements for grant of visa
Visa may be cancelled if transferring to a non-eligible education provider (before 1 July 2016)
additional_risk_conditions: Within first 12 months of visa grant
Applicant is not from a country that was Assessment Level 1 before 1 July 2016

requirements_under_esos_national_code: If less than six months of principal course completed, transfer may be restricted
Permission from existing education provider usually required unless special circumstances apply
obligations_of_education_providers: Must assess or consider transfer request
student_guidance: Review written agreement before attempting enrolment with a new provider

steps: Access internal appeal process with current education provider
If unsatisfied, appeal to external complaints handling body

welfare_arrangements_with_provider: Cannot travel to Australia until welfare arrangements commence

no_further_stay_condition.meaning: Cannot apply to stay in Australia beyond the specified date except in certain circumstances
