Breaches may result in cancellation of the main visa holder’s visa
specific_conditions: Remain a dependent family member for the duration of stay
Work no more than 40 hours per fortnight and only after the main visa holder has commenced study
Attend school if of school age
family_member_obligations.responsibility_note: Main visa holder is responsible for ensuring family members comply

child_pages.title: Postgraduate Research Sector visa (subclass 574)
child_pages.summary: This page provides information for existing holders or pending applicants of the Postgraduate Research Sector visa (subclass 574), which closed to new applications on 1 July 2016. It outlines visa validity, rights, obligations, work conditions, education provider transfer rules, and requirements for family members and students under 18.

who_this_applies_to: People already granted a Postgraduate Research Sector visa (subclass 574)
People who applied for the visa on or before 30 June 2016 and have not yet received a decision
visa_details.post_closure_instructions: If you need to extend your stay in Australia from 1 July 2016, you must apply for a Student Visa (subclass 500).

visa_validation_and_duration.how_long_visa_lasts: Valid until the expiry date given when the visa was granted

family_members.work_rights: Family members can work unlimited hours once you have commenced your masters by research or doctorate course.
study_rights: Your partner can study in Australia for up to three months.
Family members aged 18 or older who want to study for more than three months must apply for their own student visa.

work_rights.student: You can work unlimited hours once you have commenced your masters or doctorate course.
work_rights.restrictions_before_commencement: If you have commenced a preliminary course (such as ELICOS), you and your family members are restricted to working 40 hours per fortnight until you start your masters or doctorate course.

general_obligations: You must comply with your visa conditions while studying and living in Australia.
You must comply with Australian laws.
obligations.changing_course_sector: If you change to a course in a different education sector (e.g., from high school to a Diploma), you must apply for a new Student Visa (subclass 500).

svm_requirements_for_svp_holders.description: If granted under SVP (streamlined visa processing), you must continue to satisfy SVP requirements.
svm_requirements_for_svp_holders.possible_consequence: Your visa could be cancelled if you transfer to an ineligible education provider (before 1 July 2016).
risk_conditions: If within the first 12 months of your visa being granted
If you are not from a country that was Assessment Level 1 before 1 July 2016

obligations.checking_conditions: Visa conditions can be checked using Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) or the visa grant letter.

rules: If you have not completed six months of your principal course, ESOS National Code requirements apply.
Generally, you need permission from your current education provider before transferring.
Education providers must have documented transfer policies, which you should understand before attempting to enrol elsewhere.

steps: If refused permission to transfer, first access the internal appeal process with your education provider.
If still not satisfied, you may appeal to an external complaints body such as a State or Territory Ombudsman or the Overseas Student Ombudsman.

requirements: Must maintain adequate accommodation, support, and welfare arrangements for the duration of the visa or until turning 18.
Cannot travel to Australia until welfare arrangements commence as per the CAAW letter.
students_under_18.guardian_travel_rules: If a student guardian must leave Australia without the student, alternative welfare arrangements must be approved first or the visa could be cancelled.

no_further_stay_condition.description: Some visas include a 'no further stay' condition that prevents applying for another visa in Australia, except in limited circumstances.

you_must_notify_us_of: Changes to your phone number, email, address, or passport
notification_requirements.instructions: See ‘how to let us know if there is a change in your situation’.

requirements: Must remain a member of your family for the duration of their stay
Must have adequate financial support
Must maintain adequate health cover
May only work unlimited hours once the student starts their main course
Must attend school if of school age
family_members.consequence_of_breach: A breach of these conditions may result in your visa being cancelled and you may have to leave Australia.

It explains current rights, obligations, visa validity, work conditions, education provider transfers, welfare requirements for minors, and reporting obligations.

visa_validity.valid_until: The expiry date given at grant of visa

work_rights.workplace_laws: Must comply with State and Territory workplace laws

general: Must comply with all visa conditions

changing_course_sector.requirement: Must apply for a new Student Visa (subclass 500)
changing_course_sector.example: Changing from high school to a Diploma course

streamlined_visa_processing_svp.requirement: Must continue to satisfy SVP requirements
streamlined_visa_processing_svp.visa_cancellation_risk: Visa may be considered for cancellation if transferring to a non-eligible provider (before 1 July 2016)
conditions_applying_if: Within the first 12 months of visa grant
Not from a country that was Assessment Level 1 before 1 July 2016

obligations.checking_conditions: Conditions can be checked via VEVO or visa grant letter

requirements: Must comply with visa conditions
Must comply with ESOS National Code rules
changing_education_provider.six_month_rule: If principal course (main course of study) has not been completed for six months, transfer requirements apply
changing_education_provider.permission_requirement: Usually requires permission from current education provider unless special circumstances apply
provider_responsibilities: Must assess or consider transfer request
student_responsibilities: Review written agreement obligations before attempting to enrol with another provider

appeals_process.internal_appeal: If permission to transfer is denied, student must first access provider's internal appeal process
appeals_process.external_appeal: If still dissatisfied, can appeal to external body such as State/Territory Ombudsman or Overseas Student Ombudsman

welfare_requirements: Must maintain adequate accommodation, support, and welfare arrangements until visa expires or until turning 18
students_under_18.travel_requirement: Cannot travel to Australia until welfare arrangements commence
students_under_18.welfare_start_date_definition: The date nominated on the Confirmation of Appropriate Accommodation/Welfare Arrangements (CAAW) letter
students_under_18.guardian_leaving_australia_requirement: Alternative welfare arrangements must be approved before guardian leaves Australia; otherwise visa could be cancelled

no_further_stay_condition.description: Some visas include a 'no further stay' condition

notification_requirements.instructions_reference: See guidance on how to report changes in situation

child_pages.title: Guardian visa (subclass 580)
child_pages.summary: This page provides information for existing holders and pending applicants of the discontinued Student Guardian visa (subclass 580). It explains visa validity, rights, obligations, and requirements for alternative welfare arrangements. It also outlines important conditions such as 'no further stay' and reporting changes in personal circumstances.

structured_data.post_closure_instructions: If you need to extend your stay in Australia from 1 July 2016, you must apply for a Student Visa (subclass 590).
target_audience: People who have already been granted a Student Guardian visa (subclass 580)
People who applied for the visa on or before 30 June 2016 and whose application is still pending

visa_holder_tools.vevo: You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) to check your visa details and conditions.

visa_validity.valid_until: The expiry date provided at the time of visa grant.

allowed_activities: Stay in Australia for the same length of time as the nominating student, or until the student turns 18 years of age.
Study up to 20 hours per week in an English Language Intensive Course for Overseas Students (ELICOS) if the application was lodged on or after 24 March 2012.
Study in a non-ELICOS course for up to three months.

travel_conditions.general_permission: You can enter and leave Australia during the term of the visa.
travel_conditions.restriction: You cannot leave Australia without the nominating student unless specific evidence is provided.
evidence_required: Compelling compassionate circumstances for leaving without the student.
Proof of suitable alternative arrangements for the student’s accommodation, general welfare, and support until you return.

obligations.work_restrictions: You must not work while in Australia.
obligations.consequence_of_breach: If you do not comply with visa conditions, your visa may be cancelled, and the nominating student’s visa may also be cancelled.

alternative_welfare_arrangements.approval_requirement: Alternative arrangements must be approved by the Department and the student’s education provider.
alternative_welfare_arrangements.instruction: Discuss your circumstances with the education provider as soon as you know you need to travel.

methods.conditions: The guardian must be, except in limited circumstances, a parent or relative aged 21 years or over.
methods.form: Form 157N Nomination of a student guardian (291KB PDF)
submission_requirements: Approval from the education provider (letter or email)
All must be submitted before leaving Australia

methods.documentation: A Confirmation of Appropriate Accommodation and Welfare (CAAW) letter
methods.details: The CAAW letter states start and end dates for the approved welfare arrangements.

alternative_welfare_arrangements.approval_notification: The Department will inform you if the alternative arrangements are approved.
alternative_welfare_arrangements.rejection_consequence: If arrangements are not approved, you cannot leave Australia without the nominating student.

no_further_stay_condition.description: You cannot apply to stay in Australia beyond the date specified on your visa, except in certain circumstances.

reporting_requirements.reference: See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation.

It also includes a large set of repealed visas for reference. No eligibility, fee, or processing-time details are included—only visa names and subclasses.
